[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-09 05:31:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/v2/base.py', 'neutron/policy.py'], 'message': "Externalize Attr Base Check and OwnerCheck

On 'get' and 'delete', attr checks are ignored, but the returned
object list is iterated over anyhow.  This externalizes this
check so that each object is not iterated over and completes
an overall action check against the first item in the returned
object list, if OwnerCheck is detected in an OrCheck policy tree.
This reduces the response time to half of what it is currently
for both the API and OSC on large get responses.

Change-Id: I9bbd6c862c6d44e8d5ace7873c0c3932f4788086
Closes-bug: #1611626
"}]
commit_message:
Externalize Attr Base Check and OwnerCheck

On 'get' and 'delete', attr checks are ignored, but the returned
object list is iterated over anyhow.  This externalizes this
check so that each object is not iterated over and completes
an overall action check against the first item in the returned
object list, if OwnerCheck is detected in an OrCheck policy tree.
This reduces the response time to half of what it is currently
for both the API and OSC on large get responses.

Change-Id: I9bbd6c862c6d44e8d5ace7873c0c3932f4788086
Closes-bug: #1611626

subject: Change rules in firewall policy would not always set 'audited' to False.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-20 10:03:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/db/firewall/firewall_db.py'], 'message': "Change rules in firewall policy would not always set 'audited' to False.

The value of 'audited' attribute can be set to True or False when users
create a firewall policy. It shoudn't be set to False automatically when
a user insert or remove a rule to this firewall policy if it has been
explicitly set when firewall policy was created.
The 'audited' attribute only can be set to False automaticaly
when it hasn't been set when the firewall policy was created.

Change-Id: I830d3052b00e8a79081453eca9a69ab137afd76f
Partial-Bug: 1656735
"}]
commit_message:
Change rules in firewall policy would not always set 'audited' to False.

The value of 'audited' attribute can be set to True or False when users
create a firewall policy. It shoudn't be set to False automatically when
a user insert or remove a rule to this firewall policy if it has been
explicitly set when firewall policy was created.
The 'audited' attribute only can be set to False automaticaly
when it hasn't been set when the firewall policy was created.

Change-Id: I830d3052b00e8a79081453eca9a69ab137afd76f
Partial-Bug: 1656735

commit_message:
[WIP] QoS NIC bandwidth manager for Linux Bridge backend

Implements a bandwith manager for QoS plugin. This
bandwidth manager captures the total bandwidth
available in the physical NICs and increases or
decreases this quantity depending on the Neutron
ports QoS minimum bandwidth requirements.

TODO:
 - Unit tests

Related-Bug: #1578989
Change-Id: I6114de5d69c422eebdbcfa990d0df1ba9669339f

commit_message:
Include switch id in result of switch query

get_all_logical_switches_with_ports should return
both the name and id of the logical switch.
This is needed as tools such as the ovirt provider
for ovn will use id's for relations between
entities.

Change-Id: I674484f460affc93744f0f896f6edf9fe7a0f1e4
Signed-off-by: Marcin Mirecki<mmirecki@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Don't override rpc workers when set to 0

Patch stops setting rpc_workers config value to 1 if it's < 1. Previous
behavior made impossible to run neutron-server as a single process which
makes it hard to work with debugger.

Change-Id: Ib9c785d6d4e008413c02e1b2394a8e918534e657
Closes-bug: 1609863

commit_message:
Tempest: Enable creation of setup with provided port type

If tempest.conf file has port_vnic_type field, then the network
for the setup will be created with port of a given type
For example for SRIOV setup the conf file will have the value
of direct or direct-physical for port_vnic_type field

Change-Id: I178811516537d4ba183cffd7d09ceb69650e07a1

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-30 13:50:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/handlers/test_l3_rpc.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_db.py'], 'message': "Add FIP status change notifications

This patch adds FIP status change notifications via neutron
callbacks in preparation for a callback subscriber that will
publish the FIP status changes to the notification queue.
The handler that publishes notifications will come in a
follow-on patch.

The FIP status update notification uses the AFTER_UPDATE
event and thus models its payload after existing usages of such [1].
To support proper AFTER_UPDATE semantics, consumers holding
the transaction for the FIP status update are responsible for
invoking notify() on the callback registry post-commit. To support
consumer's notify() responsibility, update_floatingip_status() returns
a dict payload that can be used for the notification if an update is made.
This keeps the logic to build the payload encapsulated within l3_db.

Finally, unit tests are included in this patch to verify the respective
functionality.

[1] https://goo.gl/YluCTF
[2] https://goo.gl/W4FAiu

Partial-Bug: #1593793

Change-Id: I154ee31eebbc0f130a9301ba539cd0cab46b73f5
"}]
commit_message:
Add FIP status change notifications

This patch adds FIP status change notifications via neutron
callbacks in preparation for a callback subscriber that will
publish the FIP status changes to the notification queue.
The handler that publishes notifications will come in a
follow-on patch.

The FIP status update notification uses the AFTER_UPDATE
event and thus models its payload after existing usages of such [1].
To support proper AFTER_UPDATE semantics, consumers holding
the transaction for the FIP status update are responsible for
invoking notify() on the callback registry post-commit. To support
consumer's notify() responsibility, update_floatingip_status() returns
a dict payload that can be used for the notification if an update is made.
This keeps the logic to build the payload encapsulated within l3_db.

Finally, unit tests are included in this patch to verify the respective
functionality.

[1] https://goo.gl/YluCTF
[2] https://goo.gl/W4FAiu

Partial-Bug: #1593793

Change-Id: I154ee31eebbc0f130a9301ba539cd0cab46b73f5

commit_message:
neutron-ovs-agent: Avoid importing Linux specific modules on Windows

The neutron-ovs-agent service fails to start on Windows due to a few
Linux specific imports. This addresses this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1661326

Change-Id: Ia8549b1c06892430d6962a91e2b3c02b58d5e026

commit_message:
Support query with sort-key from standardattr

This patch support for quering core resource if user input sort-key from
standard_attrs table. Like created_at and so on.

Currently, oslo_db function paginate_query is not very good support
combination query with marker, I introduce a fix about this.
I727aafc1b6566808622a5c9a9e5a574ceb51ee97

Change-Id: I1b58bbd82f900bce53573416a6da322adba93895

commit_message:
Remove side-effect from config module

Importing neutron.common.config module has a side-effect that cli_opts
are registered. This doesn't work in case module, or any other module
importing this config module, is imported in in-tree tempest tests due
to tempest bug 1592345.

This patch registeres CLI opts explicitly only for Neutron executables.

Related-bug: #1592345

Change-Id: I89017d2d97dcc5419a4039353e6efa5cc7e9995b

FwaaS V2 will manage both L3 and L2 ports. While managing the L2 ports
it has to co-exist with SG rules. This patch enhances IPTables manager
to solve the problem of rule contention and ordering by creating
common intermediary chains for the filter table.

All packets in the filter table are redirected to this common
intermediary chain which forms the common jump point for
redirecting traffic to the SG and FWaaS specific chains. These chains
are used by SG and FwaaS drivers for populating interface specific rules.
Once the packets are filtered by both SG and FWaaS chains they are sent
to an intermediary accept chain where the packets are matched against
SG and FWaaS accept rules.

You can refer to the following google doc for the discussion leading
to this design:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yGsGwVNZuptPCzMMgBH4AHVkdoeWvQxsT5Wql7-jtHI/edit?usp=sharing

Change-Id: I690d8e69a34294a99997abbc4e1b749515c2700b
'}]
commit_message:
IPtables enhancement for co-existence of SG and FWaaS v2 drivers

FwaaS V2 will manage both L3 and L2 ports. While managing the L2 ports
it has to co-exist with SG rules. This patch enhances IPTables manager
to solve the problem of rule contention and ordering by creating
common intermediary chains for the filter table.

All packets in the filter table are redirected to this common
intermediary chain which forms the common jump point for
redirecting traffic to the SG and FWaaS specific chains. These chains
are used by SG and FwaaS drivers for populating interface specific rules.
Once the packets are filtered by both SG and FWaaS chains they are sent
to an intermediary accept chain where the packets are matched against
SG and FWaaS accept rules.

You can refer to the following google doc for the discussion leading
to this design:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yGsGwVNZuptPCzMMgBH4AHVkdoeWvQxsT5Wql7-jtHI/edit?usp=sharing

Partial-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0

Co-Authored-By: Chandan Dutta Chowdhury <chandanc@juniper.net>
Co-Authored-By: Sarath Chandra Mekala <mekala.sarath@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <Nate_Johnston@cable.comcast.com>

Change-Id: I690d8e69a34294a99997abbc4e1b749515c2700b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-13 22:07:44.000000000', 'files': ['etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/dhcp.filters', 'etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/l3.filters'], 'message': 'Update KillFilter for OpenStack on RHEL

At the moment, the OpenStack RHEL packages are built with the
she-bang line pointing towards /usr/bin/python2 which is a symlink
to /usr/bin/python2.7.  This causes problems with rootwrap not
being able to kill processes as it fails to find a matching process.

This patch address that issue by adding that extra path to prevent
this issue from occuring.  This is problematic because it spams the
logs when periodic tasks run and try to kill process non-stop but
are blocked by rootwrap.

Change-Id: If97512a512603cb2dc548541c63d5c8dde527963
'}]
commit_message:
Update KillFilter for OpenStack on RHEL

At the moment, the OpenStack RHEL packages are built with the
she-bang line pointing towards /usr/bin/python2 which is a symlink
to /usr/bin/python2.7.  This causes problems with rootwrap not
being able to kill processes as it fails to find a matching process.

This patch address that issue by adding that extra path to prevent
this issue from occuring.  This is problematic because it spams the
logs when periodic tasks run and try to kill process non-stop but
are blocked by rootwrap.

Change-Id: If97512a512603cb2dc548541c63d5c8dde527963

and check connectivity to the VM

network

commit_message:
Check the default_prefixlen, When create or update a subnetpool

Add a function to check the default_prefixlen, when create or
update a subnetpool, if it is larger than network prefixlen.
Otherwise, it will be failed to allocate a subnet, When using
it.

Change-Id: I051b8d65c8901df500bbd8fde8775620313a7a92
Closes-bug: #1644433
Co-Authored-By: Rajiv Kumar <rajiv.kumar@nectechnologies.in>

commit_message:
Add a new option "--provider:flooding_vtep ip_address=IP_ADDR"
"[,dstport=UDPPORT]" to net-create.

This option is used to configure the VTEP of VXLAN network which
can't be found by neutron automatically.

Please help review:
Spec:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/282180

Neutron server code change:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/315896

OVS agent code change:
https://review.openstack.org/317309

Linux bridge agent code change:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/316596/

Partial-Bug: #1525059

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-05 10:20:12.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'releasenotes/notes/config-move-metadata-agent-41ee35832ed423e6.yaml', 'etc/oslo-config-generator/neutron-metadata-agent.conf'], 'message': 'Move neutron-metadata-agent config file

The Neutron configuration structure is difficult to understand and

change, neutron-metadata-agent no longer needs to have --config-file
switches (for neutron.conf and metadata_agent.ini) during startup
because oslo.config has sane defaults to automatically load

Depends-On: I1fa7a7bbb80d299a7ccd46ac600664a81dd96a82
'}]
commit_message:
Move neutron-metadata-agent config file

The Neutron configuration structure is difficult to understand and
there is no reason why the configuration files end with .ini . With this
change, neutron-metadata-agent no longer needs to have --config-file
switches (for neutron.conf and metadata_agent.ini) during startup
because oslo.config has sane defaults to automatically load

- /etc/$project/$project.conf
- /etc/$project/$program.conf
- /etc/$project/$project.conf.d/*.conf
- /etc/$project/$program.conf.d/*.conf

when no --config-file/--config-dir switches are given.

DocImpact: The new default sample configuration file path is
           etc/neutron/neutron-metadata-agent.conf.sample
UpgradeImpact: Same as DocImpact

Related-Bug: #1654152
Change-Id: Id51592fff63478d005331505053e61bfd0433c0c
Depends-On: I1fa7a7bbb80d299a7ccd46ac600664a81dd96a82

subject: Let --show-details show more info
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-25 16:06:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/network.py', 'neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/__init__.py'], 'message': "Let --show-details show more info

The option --show-details of net-list currently has no effect,
it always prints 'id', 'name' and 'subnets' columns.
We should show more info while the option is specified,
for instance: 'tenant_id' and 'status'
as they are quite useful for operators especially in the
multi tenants scenario.

Change-Id: Ia5932bb23579ac656bf033f1658c426cee4fb24e
Closes-Bug: #1244551
"}]
commit_message:
Let --show-details show more info

The option --show-details of net-list currently has no effect,
it always prints 'id', 'name' and 'subnets' columns.
We should show more info while the option is specified,
for instance: 'tenant_id' and 'status'
as they are quite useful for operators especially in the
multi tenants scenario.

Change-Id: Ia5932bb23579ac656bf033f1658c426cee4fb24e
Closes-Bug: #1244551

commit_message:
Fix the regexp extracting the number of controllers

On a 3 controllers node setup, the neutronl3ha.yml file is always set due to
that regexp which is always true and always returning 1 as number of
controllers.

Closes-Bug: #1643866
Main Author: Athlan-Guyot sofer <sathlang@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Icfe4fdc5762cc264f86cd2f513b5f5b53ad7cf75

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: Ia7f04dfa7e292b3ada28e28fdfe3da4b22b7b691

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to avoid confusion with new contributions.
See: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I77f788e490de03754244cb10d7b4353338adf2fc

subject: Store user_domain in self._user_domain_id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 16:23:24.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/context.py'], 'message': 'Store user_domain in self._user_domain_id

Storing in self._user_domain was actually relying on the
oslo_context.RequestContext also storing in self._user_domain, however
this was renamed in change I203acefae8270bd3373b006fa096bea5ef3106f3
to _user_domain_id.

This change switches to _user_domain_id, which avoids infinite
recursion in the heat tripleo undercloud installer.

Change-Id: I1114611f6765e94dcab74943078066bb096f4078
Closes-Bug: #1663013
(cherry picked from commit b44b0c6970dc6a4d0f46e649d12aaff27a583f45)
'}]
commit_message:
Store user_domain in self._user_domain_id

Storing in self._user_domain was actually relying on the
oslo_context.RequestContext also storing in self._user_domain, however
this was renamed in change I203acefae8270bd3373b006fa096bea5ef3106f3
to _user_domain_id.

This change switches to _user_domain_id, which avoids infinite
recursion in the heat tripleo undercloud installer.

Change-Id: I1114611f6765e94dcab74943078066bb096f4078
Closes-Bug: #1663013
(cherry picked from commit b44b0c6970dc6a4d0f46e649d12aaff27a583f45)

commit_message:
Add a NodeData class to roll up resource data

Formalise the format for the output data from a node in the convergence
graph (i.e. resource reference ID, attributes, &c.) by creating an object
with an API rather than ad-hoc dicts.

Change-Id: I7a705b41046bfbf81777e233e56aba24f3166510
Partially-Implements: blueprint stack-definition

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 10:12:05.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cmd/cleanup.py'], 'message': 'Tempest cleanup misguides its utility

Tempest tests clean up after themselves once they are done.
Only in exceptional circumstances when the setup.py is not able
to run is the tempest cleanup command useful.

The documentation for the command does not explain this and as
such changed it to properly explain the circumstances under which
it is useful.

Change-Id: Ic5abcfa1c85f7da0e8bc3dce446f12073854c707
'}]
commit_message:
Tempest cleanup misguides its utility

Tempest tests clean up after themselves once they are done.
Only in exceptional circumstances when the setup.py is not able
to run is the tempest cleanup command useful.

The documentation for the command does not explain this and as
such changed it to properly explain the circumstances under which
it is useful.

Change-Id: Ic5abcfa1c85f7da0e8bc3dce446f12073854c707

commit_message:
[placement] Add Traits related table to the api database

This patch adds DB table `traits` and `resource_provider_traits` into
the api database.

The traits table is used to represent the trait. The resource_provider_traits
table is used to represent the relationship between trait and resource provider.

Part of implementation blueprint shared-resources-pike

Change-Id: I5c34bdd1423beab53cc4af45e016d9a9bba5ffda

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:

subject: Ignores "Not found" jobs when stopping jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-27 14:40:52.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/unit/utils/test_jobutils.py', 'os_win/utils/jobutils.py'], 'message': 'Ignores "Not found" jobs when stopping jobs

While stopping an element's jobs (e.g.: VM), we are iterating
through its jobs and get the jobs that are still pending. These jobs
can finish while looping over them, resulting in "x_wmi Not found"
exceptions.

Skips job objects that are no longer found.

Change-Id: I73476d4d9651e6b5792a94a228796292b922e843
Closes-Bug: #1668260
'}]
commit_message:
Ignores "Not found" jobs when stopping jobs

While stopping an element's jobs (e.g.: VM), we are iterating
through its jobs and get the jobs that are still pending. These jobs
can finish while looping over them, resulting in "x_wmi Not found"
exceptions.

Skips job objects that are no longer found.

Change-Id: I73476d4d9651e6b5792a94a228796292b922e843
Closes-Bug: #1668260

imports. We can safely drop import_exceptions from tox.ini.

noqa cleanup will be coming in subsequent patches.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-20 10:59:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/cmd/test_status.py', 'nova/cmd/status.py'], 'message': "nova-status: don't coerce version numbers to floats for comparison

As is comparison will fail when Placement API version 1.10 is
released, e.g. in the case: float('1.10') < float('1.4').

Use the helper provided by pkg_resources instead. The returned
values can be compared and sorted and have a string representation.

http://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/pkg_resources.html#parsing-utilities

Change-Id: Iaaca8f458671bd518b4c10c776f78b9c1ed803dd
"}]
commit_message:
nova-status: don't coerce version numbers to floats for comparison

As is comparison will fail when Placement API version 1.10 is
released, e.g. in the case: float('1.10') < float('1.4').

Use the helper provided by pkg_resources instead. The returned
values can be compared and sorted and have a string representation.

http://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/pkg_resources.html#parsing-utilities

Change-Id: Iaaca8f458671bd518b4c10c776f78b9c1ed803dd

commit_message:
devstack: When Python 3 enabled, use Python 3

In order to have Ironic installed using Python 3 when running under a
Python 3 test job, we need to enable it as a Python 3 package.

The Python 3 job still doesn't pass. But this is needed as part of the
work.

Change-Id: I6a766bbb4250d76d458db8783631e4bd834859f3

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-15 18:30:39.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/provision_v3.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/test_vmax.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/common.py'], 'message': 'VMAX driver - volumes part of CG not managed correctly

Volumes created as part of a clone CG operation (either from the
source CG or a CG snapshot) were not managed properly. This was
because the provider_location was not being set as part of the
volume_model_update. With this fix, the provider_location is set
properly for the new target Volumes which are created as part of
the cloning of the CG. Additionally, a random UUID is generated
before creating the volume and is assigned as the name of the
volume on VMAX. This UUID is stored as a part of a key-value pair
in the volume.s admin metadata. This UUID is used later to uniquely
identify the volume on the VMAX while doing a volume operation.

Change-Id: I16ab7e25202c8ce861d8654097cf17fcf9bc8295
Closes-Bug: #1669827
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - volumes part of CG not managed correctly

Volumes created as part of a clone CG operation (either from the
source CG or a CG snapshot) were not managed properly. This was
because the provider_location was not being set as part of the
volume_model_update. With this fix, the provider_location is set
properly for the new target Volumes which are created as part of
the cloning of the CG. Additionally, a random UUID is generated
before creating the volume and is assigned as the name of the
volume on VMAX. This UUID is stored as a part of a key-value pair
in the volume.s admin metadata. This UUID is used later to uniquely
identify the volume on the VMAX while doing a volume operation.

Change-Id: I16ab7e25202c8ce861d8654097cf17fcf9bc8295
Closes-Bug: #1669827

commit_message:
Use the openstack client cmd instead of cinder cmd

Try to use the openstack client command(OSC) instead of all cinder command. If
OSC command can not be found, then use cinder command.
Up to now, the commad "cinder quota-defaults" and "cinder quota-usage"
can not be replaced with OSC command.

Change-Id: I5d09ce38f4182ac72b3ef047a1dc18e8ed7f359f
Closes-Bug: #1672255

commit_message:
Allow to specify port security when creating a port

commit c886d8a2def188337e7768469b45dd51bc7f404e added a feature
to enable/disable port security when editing a port.
It sounds reasonable to allow this for port creation too.

Note that the current release note already covers this change,
so this commit does not add a new release note.

Related-Bug: #1634877

commit_message:
Use ThemableSelectWidget for themable

Some places are not using ThemableSelectWidget, so
these select ui is not themable. This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I303a9cf8c6f8f651edf68973a2f5e16a8b04b26d
Closes-bug: #1669696

commit_message:
In drawer, handle 'priority' attribute conversely against row

'priority' attribute has be handled in drawer [1][2], but the behavior
is same as in rows. The behavior is that the items which have lower
priority are hidden from both of row and drawer when wid$

Drawer is used for the supplements against the row, so it should be
handled conversely.
It means that items appear in drawer when they are hidden from row.

This patch fixes it.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1648332
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/397132/

Change-Id: Ia0487a1d95ba16d764546cdb374fe786a0f0f648
Closes-Bug: #1651658

For consistency group 'volume_type_id' is split based on a comma
because 'volume_type_id' is represented as a single string even
though it may contain multiple id. This creates an empty value in

commit_message:
VMAX driver - consistency group remove empty values

For consistency group 'volume_type_id' is split based on a comma
because 'volume_type_id' is represented as a single string even
though it may contain multiple id. This creates an empty value in
the list. This fix removes empty values from the list of volume
types.

Change-Id: I8280989d25149e1f87ab2ffac0a61f1bc3321cff
Closes-Bug: #1664621

commit_message:
api/metadata/vendordata_dynamic: don't import Requests for its constants

Python-requests isn't really needed, don't import it to prevent
copy/paste of the anti pattern of accessing it's codes directly.

Fix one unit test that was returning a 204 but actually including data
in it, but expecting that data to not be used.

Change-Id: I9f6eda0c3e6f7d390abca5e9e4ebe059788ee11f

commit_message:
OSC Network Flavor Profile

Implement Neutron feature of Network Flavor Profile
into OpenstackClient
This patch implements the following commands:
network flavor profile create
network flavor profile delete
network flavor profile list
network flavor profile show
network flavor profile set

SDK Version needed: 0.9.9

Change-Id: Ie6fe5e53122cfb2eda8d326851d54562739a8386
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-client-flavors

subject: Remove support for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-15 06:34:55.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I483587d1a53696ff406cdb59081e1274ff8c5dc0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I483587d1a53696ff406cdb59081e1274ff8c5dc0

subject: consume ServicePluginBase from neutron-lib
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-20 21:22:20.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_taas/services/taas/taas_plugin.py', 'neutron_taas/extensions/taas.py'], 'message': 'consume ServicePluginBase from neutron-lib

Neutron-lib now contains the ServicePluginBase class and

all such references from neutron to neutron-lib in accordance
with the neutron-lib rehoming.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/441129/

Change-Id: I1fe162bc6bce1ad70ae0e722e8fd824b64475fe6
'}]
commit_message:
consume ServicePluginBase from neutron-lib

Neutron-lib now contains the ServicePluginBase class and
thus is being removed from neutron [1]. This patch moves
all such references from neutron to neutron-lib in accordance
with the neutron-lib rehoming.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/441129/

Change-Id: I1fe162bc6bce1ad70ae0e722e8fd824b64475fe6

subject: Use Sphinx 1.5 warning-is-error
revisions:

With pbr 2.0 and Sphinx 1.5, the setting for treat sphinx warnings as
errors is setting warning-is-error in build_sphinx section.  Migrate the
setting from the old warnerrors one.

There are some invalid docstrings. These are cleaned up.

Change-Id: Ic6a028bab428b23255f36e5b2d64ee8d4d32978d
'}]
commit_message:
Use Sphinx 1.5 warning-is-error

With pbr 2.0 and Sphinx 1.5, the setting for treat sphinx warnings as
errors is setting warning-is-error in build_sphinx section.  Migrate the
setting from the old warnerrors one.

There are some invalid docstrings. These are cleaned up.

Change-Id: Ic6a028bab428b23255f36e5b2d64ee8d4d32978d

commit_message:
Datera: extend volume if larger than snapshot

Extend volume if during create_volume_from_snapshot() the new volume
is larger than the snapshot it was created from. Added new test case.

Co-Authored-By: Xinli Guan <xinli@us.ibm.com>

Close-Bug: #1560613

Change-Id: Ia17a0e9f65ca570b6f97691a8701e9809f4960f8
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2017-03-20 06:51:12.000000000', 'files': ['specs/pike/async_job_management.rst'], 'message': 'spec on asynchronous job management

1. What is the problem
When XJob receives a job message from service, it will register
the job in database and handle it asynchronously. Tricircle
need to provide API for users to query the job status and trigger
failed job if something happens unexpectedly. This patch provides
asynchronous job management specification, then we will develop
relevant API to manage the job according to this specification.

2. What is the solution for the problem
The new features functioning as job management APIs are covered
in this specification.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
These asynchronous job management APIs in this specification need
to be implemented.

Change-Id: I58df65b042a8866c4d8d7f5a65a3f85bcf43b62b
'}]
commit_message:
spec on asynchronous job management

1. What is the problem
When XJob receives a job message from service, it will register
the job in database and handle it asynchronously. Tricircle
need to provide API for users to query the job status and trigger
failed job if something happens unexpectedly. This patch provides
asynchronous job management specification, then we will develop
relevant API to manage the job according to this specification.

2. What is the solution for the problem
The new features functioning as job management APIs are covered
in this specification.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
These asynchronous job management APIs in this specification need
to be implemented.

Change-Id: I58df65b042a8866c4d8d7f5a65a3f85bcf43b62b

subject: do not include context to exception notification
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-17 17:20:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_exception.py'], 'message': 'do not include context to exception notification

The wrap_exception decorator optionally emited a notification.
Based on the code comments the original intention was not to include the
context to that notification due to security reasons. However the
implementation did included the context to the payload of the legacy
notification.

Recently we saw circural reference errors during the payload serialization
of this notification. Based on the logs the only complex data structure
that could cause circural reference is the context. So this patch
removes the context from the legacy exception notification.

The versioned exception notification is not affected as it does not
contain the args of the decorated function.

Conflicts:
      nova/exception_wrapper.py
      nova/tests/unit/test_exception.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to some refactor in Newton:
6329d721ef326488d5d660e4f68febf563ed93ab

Closes-Bug: #1673375
Change-Id: I1d217620e52d45595a3e0e49ed57b4ab33cd1688
(cherry picked from commit 3bf177a59cfd0b4e74dba256c3466ba2ea9bfbf7)
(cherry picked from commit a8a1915456a86f504d23f215867da730d436fe33)
(cherry picked from commit d0ee248bab6727555561c15998c58a0f11a5351b)
'}]
commit_message:
do not include context to exception notification

The wrap_exception decorator optionally emited a notification.
Based on the code comments the original intention was not to include the
context to that notification due to security reasons. However the
implementation did included the context to the payload of the legacy
notification.

Recently we saw circural reference errors during the payload serialization
of this notification. Based on the logs the only complex data structure
that could cause circural reference is the context. So this patch
removes the context from the legacy exception notification.

The versioned exception notification is not affected as it does not
contain the args of the decorated function.

Conflicts:
      nova/exception_wrapper.py
      nova/tests/unit/test_exception.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to some refactor in Newton:
6329d721ef326488d5d660e4f68febf563ed93ab

Closes-Bug: #1673375
Change-Id: I1d217620e52d45595a3e0e49ed57b4ab33cd1688
(cherry picked from commit 3bf177a59cfd0b4e74dba256c3466ba2ea9bfbf7)
(cherry picked from commit a8a1915456a86f504d23f215867da730d436fe33)
(cherry picked from commit d0ee248bab6727555561c15998c58a0f11a5351b)

Deprecate list-secgroup command

This was missed when we deprecated the network proxy APIs
and CLIs in 2.36, so we have to deprecate it here.

Change-Id: I10fab34999bc2d637334d4dc60c38976ba4cc1e8

subject: update the typo in setup.cfg from "senlin.common.wsgi = senlin.common.wsgi:list_opts" to "senlin.api.common.wsgi = senlin.api.common.wsgi:list_opts"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-20 14:33:55.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': 'update the typo in setup.cfg from
"senlin.common.wsgi = senlin.common.wsgi:list_opts"
to
"senlin.api.common.wsgi = senlin.api.common.wsgi:list_opts"

If leaving not fixed, the following error is triggered
when running gen-config script to generate the configuration
files for senlin.

[root@jeguan-ctrl-01 senlin]# tools/gen-config
WARNING:stevedore.named:Could not load senlin.api.common.wsgi

Closes-Bug: #1674326
Change-Id: Icceb156725f63556f2ca66d2f17c4cf17419f783
'}]
commit_message:
update the typo in setup.cfg from
"senlin.common.wsgi = senlin.common.wsgi:list_opts"
to
"senlin.api.common.wsgi = senlin.api.common.wsgi:list_opts"

If leaving not fixed, the following error is triggered
when running gen-config script to generate the configuration
files for senlin.

[root@jeguan-ctrl-01 senlin]# tools/gen-config
WARNING:stevedore.named:Could not load senlin.api.common.wsgi

Closes-Bug: #1674326
Change-Id: Icceb156725f63556f2ca66d2f17c4cf17419f783

subject: fix bug#1672263 which table configurations.value string(128)->string(512)
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-17 01:57:47.000000000', 'files': ['trove/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/020_configurations.py'], 'message': 'fix bug#1672263 which table configurations.value
string(128)->string(512)


It's a fix about cli command when runs with: trove configuration-create.


when running: 
>trove configuration-create limit_128_test ' 
{ "sql_mode": "\"ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY,STRICT_TRANS_TABLES,NO_ZERO_IN_DATE,
NO_ZERO_DATE,ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO,NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER,
NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION\"" } ' --datastore pxc --datastore_version pxc56

output:
>trove configuration-show xxxxx
the configuration value gets truncated when over 128 char.


As is known to all, MySQL server can operate in different SQL modes, 
and can apply these modes differently for different clients, 
depending on the value of the sql_mode system variable. 
DBAs can set the global SQL mode to match site server operating 
requirements, and each application can set its session SQL mode 
to its own requirements.
Modes affect the SQL syntax MySQL supports and the data validation 
checks it performs. This makes it easier to use MySQL in different 
environments and to use MySQL together with other database servers.


As below, I explain about the importance of SQL_mode in MySQL server.


>>> sql_mode="ALLOW_INVALID_DATES,ANSI_QUOTES,
ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO,HIGH_NOT_PRECEDENCE,
IGNORE_SPACE,NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER,NO_AUTO_VALUE_ON_ZERO,
NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES,NO_DIR_IN_CREATE,NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION,
NO_FIELD_OPTIONS,NO_KEY_OPTIONS,NO_TABLE_OPTIONS,
NO_UNSIGNED_SUBTRACTION,NO_ZERO_DATE,NO_ZERO_IN_DATE,
ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY,PAD_CHAR_TO_FULL_LENGTH,PIPES_AS_CONCAT,
REAL_AS_FLOAT,STRICT_ALL_TABLES,STRICT_TRANS_TABLES"
>>> len(sql_mode)
407


So I changed the Table configurations and datastore_version_metadata 
which changed the column value from String(128) to String(512).


Change-Id: Ibd926045567a0bdd62002ffc4d69c5521fab3f45
'}]
commit_message:
fix bug#1672263 which table configurations.value
string(128)->string(512)


It's a fix about cli command when runs with: trove configuration-create.


when running: 
>trove configuration-create limit_128_test ' 
{ "sql_mode": "\"ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY,STRICT_TRANS_TABLES,NO_ZERO_IN_DATE,
NO_ZERO_DATE,ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO,NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER,
NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION\"" } ' --datastore pxc --datastore_version pxc56

output:
>trove configuration-show xxxxx
the configuration value gets truncated when over 128 char.


As is known to all, MySQL server can operate in different SQL modes, 
and can apply these modes differently for different clients, 
depending on the value of the sql_mode system variable. 
DBAs can set the global SQL mode to match site server operating 
requirements, and each application can set its session SQL mode 
to its own requirements.
Modes affect the SQL syntax MySQL supports and the data validation 
checks it performs. This makes it easier to use MySQL in different 
environments and to use MySQL together with other database servers.


As below, I explain about the importance of SQL_mode in MySQL server.


>>> sql_mode="ALLOW_INVALID_DATES,ANSI_QUOTES,
ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO,HIGH_NOT_PRECEDENCE,
IGNORE_SPACE,NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER,NO_AUTO_VALUE_ON_ZERO,
NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES,NO_DIR_IN_CREATE,NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION,
NO_FIELD_OPTIONS,NO_KEY_OPTIONS,NO_TABLE_OPTIONS,
NO_UNSIGNED_SUBTRACTION,NO_ZERO_DATE,NO_ZERO_IN_DATE,
ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY,PAD_CHAR_TO_FULL_LENGTH,PIPES_AS_CONCAT,
REAL_AS_FLOAT,STRICT_ALL_TABLES,STRICT_TRANS_TABLES"
>>> len(sql_mode)
407


So I changed the Table configurations and datastore_version_metadata 
which changed the column value from String(128) to String(512).


Change-Id: Ibd926045567a0bdd62002ffc4d69c5521fab3f45

commit_message:
Enable to specify which vm fixed-ip to publish

This change enables to specify which vm fixed-ip will be associated to a
floating ip using:

 openstack server add floating ip <vm> <fip> --fixed-ip-address <ip>

Closes-Bug: #1624524
Change-Id: I2ddb68c5873bfed7293b0e661d1adbe111681136

This patch removes the support and add py35 for the same.

subject: Jsonify meter and meter rule functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-09 16:58:06.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/functional/network/v2/test_network_meter_rule.py', 'openstackclient/tests/functional/network/v2/test_network_meter.py'], 'message': 'Jsonify meter and meter rule functional tests

Some functional tests try to parse the CLI table output
format, that cause much work on parse string by using
regular expression. Using json format in functional tests
is better and easier way, this patch reworks for meter and
meter rule related tests.

Change-Id: I1f2a95c873a4ed23dd1afa4040900a1c7704d0bf
'}]
commit_message:
Jsonify meter and meter rule functional tests

Some functional tests try to parse the CLI table output
format, that cause much work on parse string by using
regular expression. Using json format in functional tests
is better and easier way, this patch reworks for meter and
meter rule related tests.

Change-Id: I1f2a95c873a4ed23dd1afa4040900a1c7704d0bf

commit_message:
Reduce wait condition signal number

With more then 5% of failure rate in gate. We decide to reduce the possibility
of conflict by reduce the number of signal. Will try to resume the
number back, once we feel confortable.

Change-Id: I90e1d26a67a349f897d895f750d8e57fae98ec1f
(cherry picked from commit 411daeae894c760f9e208540b03fe59422860e70)

commit_message:
Add allowed_address_pairs support in tacker CP

Currently the tacker connection point (CP) support Virtural IP only if
the security group is off (via anti_spoofing_protection off).
But it's good to have both by supporting allowed_address_pairs.
This RFE is for this purpose.

Closes-Bug: #1664805
Change-Id: I9fa1d4b69f8cbf51b047110cd6cfa61fb91a0bf0

commit_message:
Fuel plugin builder v5

- Now it is possible to deliver Fuel release configuration using the Fuel plugin
  [bp/release-as-a-plugin](https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/release-as-a-plugin)
  Using flag ``is_release: true`` in ``metadata.yaml: releases:`` section you coud
  define new fuel release.
  Also you could define ``base_release: release_template.yaml`` inside release
  description to share single template between multiple releases.
- ``*_path`` directive in is now supported in ``metadata.yaml``.
  Now you could require folder, external file or merged glob output using keys
  like ``deployment_tasks_path: 'dt.yaml'``
- It is possible to define graphs linked with plugin or releases
  directive inside ``metadata.yaml``, see the examples.
- All yaml root files is not not required except ``metadata.yaml``.
- Templates and examples for the Fuel plugins package ``v5.0.0`` are added.
- Fuel plugin builder is refactored to make all configurations traceable and
  decouple logic working with file system with validation logic and building
  logic.
  [LP1539598](https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1539598)
- Docker environment for building and creating plugins example.
- Experimental ``JSON`` manifests support added.
- Schemas are aligned with Fuel versions.
- Advanced build process reporting.
  Now FPB trying to detect all possible problems in plugin configuration
  and report them instead of failing of first of them and also could warn user
  without stopping execution.
- Now it is possible to build plugin package v4.0.0 without ``tasks.yaml``

Change-Id: I55d0313db7cd64ab16802a75ff0d9edd16782d01
Implements-blueprint: release-as-a-plugin
Closes-Bug: #1539598
Closes-Bug: #1552248

commit_message:
Get rid of custom wrap_db_retry call in sync_allocations

Just for consistency, get rid of the last direct call to
wrap_db_retry and instead use neutron.db.api.retry_db_errors
in the sync_allocations code so we don't potentially get
bitten by slight inconsistencies between the two.

TrivialFix
Related-Bug: #1673243

Change-Id: I975c7d0ec84698d277acbbec6d9cfec5c03439aa

commit_message:
Resolve evaluation of bifrost-keystone-client-config

The owner parameter for some of the tasks for the Keystone
client configuration does not have a default fallback, which
results in a failure if SUDO_USER is not set in the environment.

This patch adds the missing default fallbacks so that it can safely
evaluate to root if it missing from the environment.

Related-Bug: #1674483

Change-Id: I31a2a33e2fb3b004dfec179426c7d1b4c72301d2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 01:11:46.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'message': "RBD driver doesn't flatten image when clone depth > configured value.

RBD driver has a rbd_max_clone_depth config option which would trigger
image flatten operation when a RBD image has been chain-cloned to that
value.  But the driver only trigger flatten when actual clone depth
equals rbd_max_clone_depth.  There are cases where actual clone depth
is bigger than rbd_max_clone_depth (for example: admin somehow changed
rbd_max_clone_depth from a bigger value to a smaller value),
auto-flatten won't be triggered.  This change allows RBD driver to
flatten image has been cloned >= rbd_max_clone_depth.

Change-Id: I6a69431df07ce2ca6770ba3e72aa26d02b6dbef3
Closes-Bug: #1644129
"}]
commit_message:
RBD driver doesn't flatten image when clone depth > configured value.

RBD driver has a rbd_max_clone_depth config option which would trigger
image flatten operation when a RBD image has been chain-cloned to that
value.  But the driver only trigger flatten when actual clone depth
equals rbd_max_clone_depth.  There are cases where actual clone depth
is bigger than rbd_max_clone_depth (for example: admin somehow changed
rbd_max_clone_depth from a bigger value to a smaller value),
auto-flatten won't be triggered.  This change allows RBD driver to
flatten image has been cloned >= rbd_max_clone_depth.

Change-Id: I6a69431df07ce2ca6770ba3e72aa26d02b6dbef3
Closes-Bug: #1644129

commit_message:
overcloud_containers.yaml defaults

The only uploader implementation is 'docker' so this is now made the
default.

docker.io is set to the default registry.

This makes overcloud_containers.yaml easier to maintain.

Change-Id: I1f6b751ae844d804125c4ae7b022e3ce4de9723d

1. What is the problem?
Currently, the allowed-address-pairs is not supported in the Tricircle.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Enable allowed address pairs in central neutron.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle
to realize the solution?

commit_message:
Enable allowed address pairs

1. What is the problem?
Currently, the allowed-address-pairs is not supported in the Tricircle.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Enable allowed address pairs in central neutron.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I5c4f1bf1b146d5fdf49c14d43f7226d81770e667

in fact the range of available local vlan is 1-4094,

modify moves.range(p_const.MIN_VLAN_TAG, p_const.MAX_VLAN_TAG+1)

commit_message:
add 4094 to fix the range of available local vlans

in fact the range of available local vlan is 1-4094,
but when initialization of the local vlan in ovs_neutron_agent,
self.available_local_vlans is set([1,2,3...4093]),omit 4094
This causes a problem that ovs-agent will not use 4094 as local vlan

modify moves.range(p_const.MIN_VLAN_TAG, p_const.MAX_VLAN_TAG+1)

Closes-Bug: #1668908
Change-Id: Ic25929cad89ab2e31fdf5b70875b84491dfc52ed

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-03-15 14:16:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_external_process.py', 'requirements.txt', 'neutron/agent/linux/external_process.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/requirements.txt'], 'message': "Don't return null-byte separated string from ExternalProcess.cmdline()

Instead construct the string using psutil.Process.cmdline() method that
will parse the data from kernel for us and will return a proper
space-separated command line (plus will provide some more safety
guarantees, e.g. against zombies).

This change also introduces a new psutil dependency for neutron. Before
that, the library was used in functional tests only, and with a minimal
version number that is not compatible with global-requirements.txt or
.cmdline(). Moved the requirement into runtime requirements.

Related-Bug: #1672921
Change-Id: I780ea10bd1870c86c1a048071863843bc2993958
"}]
commit_message:
Don't return null-byte separated string from ExternalProcess.cmdline()

Instead construct the string using psutil.Process.cmdline() method that
will parse the data from kernel for us and will return a proper
space-separated command line (plus will provide some more safety
guarantees, e.g. against zombies).

This change also introduces a new psutil dependency for neutron. Before
that, the library was used in functional tests only, and with a minimal
version number that is not compatible with global-requirements.txt or
.cmdline(). Moved the requirement into runtime requirements.

Related-Bug: #1672921
Change-Id: I780ea10bd1870c86c1a048071863843bc2993958

commit_message:
Don't let dlt_vopt exceptions bubble up in CreateAndConnectCfgDrive reversion

If dlt_vopt raises an exception in the reversion flow, it will mask
the original error in spawn which prompted the reversion.

Closes-Bug: #1674383

Change-Id: I6206e891c6a1df142f4438bef6776b01bd72e2dc
(cherry picked from commit 59d3164bd80ce6bba9a8e7e926cc578537d735fa)

subject: Use StoryBoard for Interop repositories
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-20 20:37:43.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Use StoryBoard for Interop repositories

The Refstack team and Interop working group have agreed to move
their task and defect tracking into StoryBoard, so all repositories
for official Refstack deliverables (refstack, refstack-client) along
with the defcore repo get the use-storyboard flag and are added to a
new interop project group. Also add a refstack project group just
for the Refstack team's deliverables.

Change-Id: I51094fc5b0140b71b69eaf26848be5ee5f68d9e4
"}]
commit_message:
Use StoryBoard for Interop repositories

The Refstack team and Interop working group have agreed to move
their task and defect tracking into StoryBoard, so all repositories
for official Refstack deliverables (refstack, refstack-client) along
with the defcore repo get the use-storyboard flag and are added to a
new interop project group. Also add a refstack project group just
for the Refstack team's deliverables.

Change-Id: I51094fc5b0140b71b69eaf26848be5ee5f68d9e4

revisions:
[{'number': 56, 'created': '2017-03-20 19:02:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/network/v2/network_agent.py', 'doc/source/command-objects/network-agent.rst', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/network/v2/test_network_agent.py', 'openstackclient/tests/functional/network/v2/test_network_agent.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bp-network-dhcp-adv-commands-e61bf8757f46dc93.yaml', 'doc/source/command-objects/network.rst', 'openstackclient/network/v2/network.py', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/network/v2/test_network.py', 'setup.cfg', 'openstackclient/tests/functional/network/v2/test_network.py'], 'message': 'Introduce Neutron DHCP agent commands to OSC

This patch introduces neutron dhcp-agent related commands to OpenStack
client.

The equivalent neutron commands implemented in OSC:

neutron: dhcp-agent-list-hosting-net
OSC: network agent list --network

neutron: dhcp-agent-network-add
OSC: network agent add network

neutron: dhcp-agent-network-remove
OSC: network agent remove network

neutron: net-list-on-dhcp-agent
OSC: network list --agent

Change-Id: I77a933f4b3ce875c63cef5b6a32aee78fd844b03
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce Neutron DHCP agent commands to OSC

This patch introduces neutron dhcp-agent related commands to OpenStack
client.

The equivalent neutron commands implemented in OSC:

neutron: dhcp-agent-list-hosting-net
OSC: network agent list --network

neutron: dhcp-agent-network-add
OSC: network agent add network

neutron: dhcp-agent-network-remove
OSC: network agent remove network

neutron: net-list-on-dhcp-agent
OSC: network list --agent

Change-Id: I77a933f4b3ce875c63cef5b6a32aee78fd844b03

subject: Use StoryBoard for Monasca repositories
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-20 20:06:05.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Use StoryBoard for Monasca repositories

The Monasca team has agreed to move their task and defect tracking
into StoryBoard, so all repositories for official Monasca
deliverables get the use-storyboard flag and, if missing, the
monasca project group added. Also do this for the monasca-events-api
repo which seems to have been overlooked in governance (but still
shares the monasca bug project in LP and monasca's Gerrit ACL).

Change-Id: I57434924c7818d859cf5b725094ce397a9c112ca
"}]
commit_message:
Use StoryBoard for Monasca repositories

The Monasca team has agreed to move their task and defect tracking
into StoryBoard, so all repositories for official Monasca
deliverables get the use-storyboard flag and, if missing, the
monasca project group added. Also do this for the monasca-events-api
repo which seems to have been overlooked in governance (but still
shares the monasca bug project in LP and monasca's Gerrit ACL).

Change-Id: I57434924c7818d859cf5b725094ce397a9c112ca

commit_message:
Don't let dlt_vopt exceptions bubble up in CreateAndConnectCfgDrive reversion

If dlt_vopt raises an exception in the reversion flow, it will mask
the original error in spawn which prompted the reversion.

Closes-Bug: #1674383

Change-Id: I6206e891c6a1df142f4438bef6776b01bd72e2dc

commit_message:
Use VDisk storage element to match and remove scsi mappings

The VDisk storage element holds the name property which is used to
match and find the right mapping to remove. The FileIO does not
directly inherit VDisk and the instanceof check fails in the
pypowervm find_map.

Change-Id: Idccfc8ecf5da683072b4f380e2c458c5ca51014c
Closes-Bug: #1666466
(cherry picked from commit e0aef05406f3f54d40edcbbfc8740b42f068d763)

commit_message:
Make MAC address of port updatable

openstackclient does not allow the update of a port's MAC address.
However this is possible in neutron API (though by default policy
it is an admin-only operation). Allow it in openstackclient too.

Change-Id: Ibd9e0a6fbd1d0d461b8a8daee24dbb7c3f929df6
Closes-Bug: #1670707

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-03 13:13:45.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/notifiers/batch_notifier.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/notifiers/test_batch_notifier.py'], 'message': 'Turn nova notifier into a proper rate limiter

This adjusts the batching logic in the Nova notifier to immediately
send and then sleep to allow batching of subsequent calls in the batch
interval.

So rather than always wait for 2 seconds to elapse while batching,
batching will only occur in the 2 second period after a call is made.
This turns the batch notifier into a standard queuing rate limiter.

The upside to this is a single port create results in an immediate
notification to Nova without a delay.

The downside is now that a sudden burst of 6 port creations to a
previously idle server will result in 2 notification calls to Nova
(1 for the first call and another for the other 5).

Closes-Bug: #1564648
Change-Id: I82f403441564955345f47877151e0c457712dd2f
'}]
commit_message:
Turn nova notifier into a proper rate limiter

This adjusts the batching logic in the Nova notifier to immediately
send and then sleep to allow batching of subsequent calls in the batch
interval.

So rather than always wait for 2 seconds to elapse while batching,
batching will only occur in the 2 second period after a call is made.
This turns the batch notifier into a standard queuing rate limiter.

The upside to this is a single port create results in an immediate
notification to Nova without a delay.

The downside is now that a sudden burst of 6 port creations to a
previously idle server will result in 2 notification calls to Nova
(1 for the first call and another for the other 5).

Closes-Bug: #1564648
Change-Id: I82f403441564955345f47877151e0c457712dd2f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-04 14:27:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/server_external_events.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Add some extra logging around external event handling

While debugging a failed event delivery bug, I realized that our
logging of the event path leaves some ambiguity which makes it
difficult to follow. This adds the instance host to the existing
debug message on the API side, which helps to identify that events
are being sent to the right (or wrong) host. Further, which logs
a warning in the case where a compute host receives an instance
message when no thread was waiting for it.

Change-Id: I9a1461493a19750fe5dc11869cfa33d2e6fd3c6f
'}]
commit_message:
Add some extra logging around external event handling

While debugging a failed event delivery bug, I realized that our
logging of the event path leaves some ambiguity which makes it
difficult to follow. This adds the instance host to the existing
debug message on the API side, which helps to identify that events
are being sent to the right (or wrong) host. Further, which logs
a warning in the case where a compute host receives an instance
message when no thread was waiting for it.

Change-Id: I9a1461493a19750fe5dc11869cfa33d2e6fd3c6f

subject: Fixes multiple issues with retry function in rhel-registration.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-03-14 13:50:37.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/scripts/rhel-registration'], 'message': 'Fixes multiple issues with retry function in rhel-registration.

There were multiple issues in retry() in rhel-registration:
 - There was no need for it to be recursive (local variables
   got overwritten)
 - There was no delay between multiple attempts, leading to faster but
   more frequent failures.
 - The max number of attempts was set too low for some environements.

With this patch, rhel-registration now works more reliably with slow-links
for portal registration and does not attempt to DDos the portal or your
satellite server.

Change-Id: I594d3c94867b45a7a58766dbcc66edead78d6a4e
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes multiple issues with retry function in rhel-registration.

There were multiple issues in retry() in rhel-registration:
 - There was no need for it to be recursive (local variables
   got overwritten)
 - There was no delay between multiple attempts, leading to faster but
   more frequent failures.
 - The max number of attempts was set too low for some environements.

With this patch, rhel-registration now works more reliably with slow-links
for portal registration and does not attempt to DDos the portal or your
satellite server.

Change-Id: I594d3c94867b45a7a58766dbcc66edead78d6a4e

subject: Remove '\n' linebreak from localised string
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-20 09:33:00.000000000', 'files': ['src/js/components/deployment_plan/DeploymentPlan.js'], 'message': "Remove '\n' linebreak from localised string

This is causing the string to be created without end quote in the pot
file, making it invalid and impossible be upload to Zanata. No new
strings can be added to Zanata until this is resolved.

Note that this doesn't seem to change the tooltip as actually displayed,
as \n doesn't appear to be interpreted as a line break at the moment.

Change-Id: Ic4c07aade661226a6a9cf3106a0dfae0586433a8
Partial-Bug: #1674011
"}]
commit_message:
Remove '\n' linebreak from localised string

This is causing the string to be created without end quote in the pot
file, making it invalid and impossible be upload to Zanata. No new
strings can be added to Zanata until this is resolved.

Note that this doesn't seem to change the tooltip as actually displayed,
as \n doesn't appear to be interpreted as a line break at the moment.

Change-Id: Ic4c07aade661226a6a9cf3106a0dfae0586433a8
Partial-Bug: #1674011

Fix Manage Replicas button availability

Some share types don't support replication. It should be checked along with
the replication availability itself to make "Manage Replicas" button properly
enabled or disabled.

subject: Fixes v3 identity tests with policy actions with rule admin_or_owner.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-16 21:27:11.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/identity/v3/test_users_rbac.py'], 'message': 'Fixes v3 identity tests with policy actions with rule admin_or_owner.

Currently, v3 identity tests like show_user fail because Keystone
only allows a non-admin user to show itself, not any other user.

These v3 identity tests are failing on admin_or_owner policy actions
because Keystone interprets "user_id" as "your own" user_id.
admin_or_owner policy action is defined as "user_id: %(user_id)s",
so any tests with that policy rule are currently failing.

The solution is to not dynamically create users during these tests
and instead pass the current Tempest user_id to these APIs, so
that the tests pass for Member (and not just admin).

Change-Id: I5dc0914c95c51194dfee7c823488c4d346bda884
Partial-Bug: #1670553
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes v3 identity tests with policy actions with rule admin_or_owner.

Currently, v3 identity tests like show_user fail because Keystone
only allows a non-admin user to show itself, not any other user.

These v3 identity tests are failing on admin_or_owner policy actions
because Keystone interprets "user_id" as "your own" user_id.
admin_or_owner policy action is defined as "user_id: %(user_id)s",
so any tests with that policy rule are currently failing.

The solution is to not dynamically create users during these tests
and instead pass the current Tempest user_id to these APIs, so
that the tests pass for Member (and not just admin).

Change-Id: I5dc0914c95c51194dfee7c823488c4d346bda884
Partial-Bug: #1670553

commit_message:
Neutron Feature Classification

The feature classification matrix will provide information about
plugins and the features they support.
Acts as a launching point for users to read about the intent
of the matrix before reviewing the matrix to find features and plugins
that meet their needs.

Will implement a page where users can view Neutron features
and plugins and their status.
Similar to Nova's implementation here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/feature_classification.html
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/support-matrix.html

Co-Authored-By: Darek Smigiel <dariusz.smigiel@intel.com>

Closes-Bug: #1580327

Change-Id: I67f4dc67883623decdbf136c598eb9e2d0bc24c4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-17 17:08:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception_wrapper.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_exception.py'], 'message': 'do not include context to exception notification

The wrap_exception decorator optionally emited a notification.
Based on the code comments the original intention was not to include the
context to that notification due to security reasons. However the
implementation did included the context to the payload of the legacy
notification.

Recently we saw circural reference errors during the payload serialization
of this notification. Based on the logs the only complex data structure
that could cause circural reference is the context. So this patch
removes the context from the legacy exception notification.

The versioned exception notification is not affected as it does not
contain the args of the decorated function.

Closes-Bug: #1673375
Change-Id: I1d217620e52d45595a3e0e49ed57b4ab33cd1688
(cherry picked from commit 3bf177a59cfd0b4e74dba256c3466ba2ea9bfbf7)
(cherry picked from commit a8a1915456a86f504d23f215867da730d436fe33)
'}]
commit_message:
do not include context to exception notification

The wrap_exception decorator optionally emited a notification.
Based on the code comments the original intention was not to include the
context to that notification due to security reasons. However the
implementation did included the context to the payload of the legacy
notification.

Recently we saw circural reference errors during the payload serialization
of this notification. Based on the logs the only complex data structure
that could cause circural reference is the context. So this patch
removes the context from the legacy exception notification.

The versioned exception notification is not affected as it does not
contain the args of the decorated function.

Closes-Bug: #1673375
Change-Id: I1d217620e52d45595a3e0e49ed57b4ab33cd1688
(cherry picked from commit 3bf177a59cfd0b4e74dba256c3466ba2ea9bfbf7)
(cherry picked from commit a8a1915456a86f504d23f215867da730d436fe33)

commit_message:
Simplify the format of paragraphs

There's a rather complicated bit of code used to split blocks of text
into paragraphs. Replace this with something a little simpler that makes
use of our paragraph-ization rather than trying to rebuild blocks of
text.

Change-Id: I321ba57d0f7090afec34c6207f9a42493b8a3249

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-20 12:26:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/type_vlan.py'], 'message': 'Fixes DBDeadlock race condition during driver initialization.

When multiple controllers are initially built, the ml2_vlan_allocations
will be empty and the neutron servers under different controllers will
try to populate the entry at the same time. This will cause this
DBDeadlock error as they try to access the db at the same time.

This patch set is to add db_api.retry_db_error decorator in the
_sync_vlan_allocations method to avoid this race condition.

commit_message:
Fixes DBDeadlock race condition during driver initialization.

When multiple controllers are initially built, the ml2_vlan_allocations
will be empty and the neutron servers under different controllers will
try to populate the entry at the same time. This will cause this
DBDeadlock error as they try to access the db at the same time.

This patch set is to add db_api.retry_db_error decorator in the
_sync_vlan_allocations method to avoid this race condition.

Change-Id: I7c0e3ae515f592a5852e6decf6820b103f146761
Closes-bug: 1617499
(cherry picked from commit 55b6c6a63a97c86ce06ff4dc87d6f253f0f6fea4)

subject: Use purged for firewalld
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-17 22:27:31.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'message': "Use purged for firewalld

If the undercloud node was installed via anaconda gui, the anaconda-core
and related packages may be installed. These packages have a dependency
on firewalld which can result in an install failure. To ensure that we
don't fail, we need to use purge which will also cause the dependencies
to get removed as well.

Change-Id: Ib46e1545d3843ff0306e6711939840fe2fb407dc
Closes-Bug: #1669915
(cherry picked from commit a0f57042bbb0d7071cfc83b5c1a420b591c81e23)
"}]
commit_message:
Use purged for firewalld

If the undercloud node was installed via anaconda gui, the anaconda-core
and related packages may be installed. These packages have a dependency
on firewalld which can result in an install failure. To ensure that we
don't fail, we need to use purge which will also cause the dependencies
to get removed as well.

Change-Id: Ib46e1545d3843ff0306e6711939840fe2fb407dc
Closes-Bug: #1669915
(cherry picked from commit a0f57042bbb0d7071cfc83b5c1a420b591c81e23)

commit_message:
Preserve all LogRecord fields from privileged side

Followup to Ifc63aedbec4ababefd2138cb73b348e2698db4ad: That change added
a new async priv->unpriv mechanism for passing structured logging
messages, and preserved basic log level.

This change preserves _all_ LogRecord attributes, including the stack
trace on the privileged side (with `LOG.log(exc_info=True)`).

Change-Id: I474ccf43eb921976751a7d970c9880a8ff3db1d7

commit_message:
Tune apache connection limits down

We are facing memory pressure in gate testing. Apache is fairly large so
tune its connection limits down to try and squeeze out more useable
memory. THis should be fine for dev envs, also tlsproxy is not enabled
by default so we can check that this tuning works well on a subset of
jobs before making it default everywhere.

Data comparisons done with gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-xenial
jobs.

Old: http://logs.openstack.org/37/447037/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-xenial/721fc6f/logs/screen-peakmem_tracker.txt.gz
       PID   %MEM             RSS       PPID       TIME     NLWP WCHAN                     COMMAND
     20504    0.2           16660      19589   00:00:00       34 -                         /usr/sbin/apache2 -k start
     20505    0.2           16600      19589   00:00:00       34 -                         /usr/sbin/apache2 -k start
     20672    0.2           16600      19589   00:00:00       34 -                         /usr/sbin/apache2 -k start
     20503    0.1           14388      19589   00:00:00       34 -                         /usr/sbin/apache2 -k start
     19589    0.1            9964          1   00:00:00        1 -                         /usr/sbin/apache2 -k start
Total RSS: 74212

New: http://logs.openstack.org/41/446741/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-xenial/fa4d2e6/logs/screen-peakmem_tracker.txt.gz
       PID   %MEM             RSS       PPID       TIME     NLWP WCHAN                     COMMAND
      8036    0.1           15316       8018   00:00:01       34 -                         /usr/sbin/apache2 -k start
      8037    0.1           15228       8018   00:00:01       34 -                         /usr/sbin/apache2 -k start
      8018    0.1            8584          1   00:00:00        1 -                         /usr/sbin/apache2 -k start
Total RSS: 39128

Note RSS here is in KB. Total difference is 35084KB or about
34MB. Not the biggest change, but we seem to be functional and it
almost halves the apache overhead.

Change-Id: If82fa347db140021197a215113df4ce38fb4fd17

subject: FileDriver:Support multiple processes
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-17 01:20:53.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/tests/test_coordination.py', 'tooz/drivers/file.py'], 'message': "FileDriver:Support multiple processes

The interprocess file-lock is not really released when user call
FileLock.release() method. So the second process will be blocked
when it try to acquire a lock which has been 'released' by the
first process until the first process is exited. This lead to
current filelock don't support multiple processes. This patch
fixed this problem.

Closes-Bug: #1665897
Change-Id: I3d4331a400dd551fa97cada2d7af9415fda720da
"}]
commit_message:
FileDriver:Support multiple processes

The interprocess file-lock is not really released when user call
FileLock.release() method. So the second process will be blocked
when it try to acquire a lock which has been 'released' by the
first process until the first process is exited. This lead to
current filelock don't support multiple processes. This patch
fixed this problem.

Closes-Bug: #1665897
Change-Id: I3d4331a400dd551fa97cada2d7af9415fda720da

commit_message:
Fix usage of various deprecated methods

Our unittest output complains about some of the codebase,
described in more detail in the referred bug. This change
fixes all of those places.

static_root is now set only if debug=True is set in pecan
configuration.

Logging is now setup as part of the conf module import,
so that unittests can use it.

Closes-Bug: #1668240
Change-Id: I2536bd2b174e0d224ddf6806f1be37bd29017669

commit_message:
overcloud-deploy: unset -e flag in deploy script

When -e flag is set, overcloud deploy command failure prevents the rest
of the script to be processed, and failure log is not created
Unsetting -e flag fixes the issue

Change-Id: I4e68f24375c139e03dd4bc7659a03bdc3b661650

commit_message:
tempest: Fix junit results generation

Since a1aab3eacc3b086ca16476ee696220463c69f1cb the junit results are
not created anymore and it breaks backward compatibility.
From ocata release, the openstack-tempest package doesn't require
the python-junitxml package required for junit results. We also need
to install junitxml when using venv.

Change-Id: Iecc635d8da0f289147bca6d051182651f4aaa91c
Closes-Bug: #1670469

subject: Partially revert removal of time.sleep if v3 auth enabled in conf.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-17 02:20:42.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_utils.py'], 'message': 'Partially revert removal of time.sleep if v3 auth enabled in conf.

In a previous patch [0], an attempt was made to speed up Patrole
tests by skipping over time.sleep(1) if v3 auth was enabled
in tempest.conf.

However, this resulted in more tests failing than otherwise should
be for non-admin roles (i.e. Member role). This is because:

"Fernet tokens are not subsecond aware and Keystone should only be
 precise to the second. Sleep to ensure we are passing the second
 boundary before attempting to authenticate." [1][2]

This patch guarantees that time.sleep(1) is always executed,
regardless of identity auth version used by Tempest. While this
prolongs the test runs in the gates, this change is necessary
to guarantee correct test execution for non-admin roles.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444967/
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/api/identity/v2/test_users.py
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/api/identity/v3/test_users.py

Change-Id: I007190906e710f540ed0e44e76bd17047fcddea4
Closes-Bug: #1673497
'}]
commit_message:
Partially revert removal of time.sleep if v3 auth enabled in conf.

In a previous patch [0], an attempt was made to speed up Patrole
tests by skipping over time.sleep(1) if v3 auth was enabled
in tempest.conf.

However, this resulted in more tests failing than otherwise should
be for non-admin roles (i.e. Member role). This is because:

"Fernet tokens are not subsecond aware and Keystone should only be
 precise to the second. Sleep to ensure we are passing the second
 boundary before attempting to authenticate." [1][2]

This patch guarantees that time.sleep(1) is always executed,
regardless of identity auth version used by Tempest. While this
prolongs the test runs in the gates, this change is necessary
to guarantee correct test execution for non-admin roles.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444967/
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/api/identity/v2/test_users.py
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/api/identity/v3/test_users.py

Change-Id: I007190906e710f540ed0e44e76bd17047fcddea4
Closes-Bug: #1673497

subject: Non-Admin can't list own projects
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2017-03-20 01:41:05.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/command-objects/project.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1627555-3b47eba215e35b3c.yaml', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/project.py', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/identity/v3/test_project.py'], 'message': "Non-Admin can't list own projects

Due to a default Keystone policy until Newtown,
and the use of resource_find, non-admins are unable
to list their own projects.

This patch bypasses this problem while also introducing better
UX for non-admins wishing to get their project list.

'openstack project list' retains the default of 'list all projects'
but on a forbidden error will default instead to 'list my projects'.
This way for non-admins 'list my projects' feels like the default
without breaking the expected admin default.

Adding the '--my-projects' option allows admins to easily list their
own projects or allows non-admins to be explicit and bypass the
forbidden error fallback.

Change-Id: I1021276f69fbbf28e13e17c4e567d932fce7ed8b
Closes-Bug: #1627555
"}]
commit_message:
Non-Admin can't list own projects

Due to a default Keystone policy until Newtown,
and the use of resource_find, non-admins are unable
to list their own projects.

This patch bypasses this problem while also introducing better
UX for non-admins wishing to get their project list.

'openstack project list' retains the default of 'list all projects'
but on a forbidden error will default instead to 'list my projects'.
This way for non-admins 'list my projects' feels like the default
without breaking the expected admin default.

Adding the '--my-projects' option allows admins to easily list their
own projects or allows non-admins to be explicit and bypass the
forbidden error fallback.

Change-Id: I1021276f69fbbf28e13e17c4e567d932fce7ed8b
Closes-Bug: #1627555

commit_message:
Backlog spec describing Nova's quota needs

This is to aid cross project discussion on quotas, we can discuss what
Nova sees as its current quota needs.

This starts to hint at the relationship between the Placement API
definition of Resource Classes and the management of quotas.
It also adopts the concept of limits being stored in Keystone.

Change-Id: I4e757f7e67b304ee05536137f4862e242684de55

subject: Add better support for multi-OS deployments
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-03-20 13:00:42.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/repo-build.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/multi-os-wheel-repos-7910b13547ea59ad.yaml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/repo_all.yml', 'playbooks/utility-install.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': "Add better support for multi-OS deployments

This change adds a few variables which allow it to consume a repo-server
setup which has releases based on OS and ARCH. The changes require a
deployer to have at least one repo-server per-OS type being deployed.
This means that if a deployer wanted to do a mixed CentOS 7 and Ubuntu
16.04 deployment they'd need at least one repo server in each of OS type
which facilitates the building of wheels for each OS.

Change-Id: Ifd5ff22ae47bc9a2a88c1bbb2632ce48ba5accbf
Closes-Bug: 1641131
Depends-On: I3f36afa307e02a38d73b860fc23ed94a09882c34
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cacf41028b1fe398175d34cc298ce39042edf09e)
"}]
commit_message:
Add better support for multi-OS deployments

This change adds a few variables which allow it to consume a repo-server
setup which has releases based on OS and ARCH. The changes require a
deployer to have at least one repo-server per-OS type being deployed.
This means that if a deployer wanted to do a mixed CentOS 7 and Ubuntu
16.04 deployment they'd need at least one repo server in each of OS type
which facilitates the building of wheels for each OS.

Change-Id: Ifd5ff22ae47bc9a2a88c1bbb2632ce48ba5accbf
Closes-Bug: 1641131
Depends-On: I3f36afa307e02a38d73b860fc23ed94a09882c34
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cacf41028b1fe398175d34cc298ce39042edf09e)

subject: Check if changes have made before attempting a rebalance
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-20 13:04:46.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/swift_rings_build.yml', 'templates/swift_rings.py.j2', 'tests/os_swift-overrides.yml'], 'message': 'Check if changes have made before attempting a rebalance

Utilize the "ringbuilder.devs_changed" option to ensure that the ring
needs a rebalance. This will prevent unnecessary rebalances that cause
failures due to "min_part_hours" not being passed even though no changes
were required.

Additionally, we can now return a correct Ansible repsonse when the ring
has changed/rebalanced - and return "OK" when it hasn't returned at all.

Change-Id: I1fb4b3544a50ab5f566b3846d616107a84ff29c9
'}]
commit_message:
Check if changes have made before attempting a rebalance

Utilize the "ringbuilder.devs_changed" option to ensure that the ring
needs a rebalance. This will prevent unnecessary rebalances that cause
failures due to "min_part_hours" not being passed even though no changes
were required.

Additionally, we can now return a correct Ansible repsonse when the ring
has changed/rebalanced - and return "OK" when it hasn't returned at all.

Change-Id: I1fb4b3544a50ab5f566b3846d616107a84ff29c9

commit_message:
Clean up injected role vars

Injected role vars, in cases where the vars were not generated
within the playbook run, are not ideal. In the case of our venv vars,
it removes the ability for a deploy to manipulate the venv download
tag or path using group vars.

This cleanup standardizes the venv tag and download url vars using
group vars.
I also removed several unnecessary definitions of
pip_lock_to_internal_repo in the playbooks since it is already
defined in the group_vars/all.yml.

Change-Id: Iddf27179d5babb91f4518202bdae5855f110b958
(cherry picked from commit 91e3de51f240ea4a6f2a047bd869b19fa5b5efa9)

If a user passes a block device, e.g. /dev/sdx, that doesn't actually
exist, then the user made a mistake and the deployment should fail.
Without this change if /dev/sdx doesn't exist, then a directory is
