commit_message:
Fail deployment if non-existent block devices are passed for OSDs

If a user passes a block device, e.g. /dev/sdx, that doesn't actually
exist, then the user made a mistake and the deployment should fail.
Without this change if /dev/sdx doesn't exist, then a directory is
created called /dev/sdx and set up as a directory-backed OSD. This
patch adds a check to fail the deployment if the requested OSD is
a directory with a name starting with /dev.

Change-Id: I5f03fc332b8df3914dc8609a203eb38693cb87a7
Closes-Bug: 1665697

commit_message:
remove hacking rule that enforces log translation

Log translation is no longer being done [1] [2] so there
is no point in enforcing it going forwards.

Remove the hacking enforcement so that new commits need
not include this unused feature and so that we can remove
this unused il8n markup in existing code.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/thread.html#113365
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/446762/

Change-Id: I31f35b0597e161a1654467f5a0a2348789292d83

commit_message:
Bind redis-sentinel to its network

We currently do not bind redis-sentinel to any IP:
redis      21144  0.0  0.0 142908  5908 ?        Ssl  07:43   0:11 /usr/bin/redis-sentinel *:26379 [sentinel]

Let's bind it to the same network as redis.

Change-Id: I8a782ae1db84eb614aa3995a1638a2f370e70d06
Partial-Bug: #1673715

commit_message:
raise the version of appdirs to match what virtualenv uses

We're trying to install incompatible versions of appdirs, and in the
process breaking when we try to toggle back and forth [1]. Raise the
version of appdirs used to match what virtualenv brings with it to start
so that we avoid the toggle.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/86/445186/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-cliff-ubuntu-xenial/2f8c8c0/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2017-03-16_17_55_48_873

Change-Id: Ia95bbb7e4dd3503bf87559a118c0b197151fde16
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Update deprecated allocation ratios

The nova allocation ratio settings have been moved from the scheduler to
the main nova class. They are being removed from the scheduler class and
need to be passed to nova differently.

Change-Id: I753c795ef62a505b7b2499b3805acb43d1f79b4d
Closes-Bug: #1673893

commit_message:
Fixes router external_fixed_ip tests sometimes failing with Conflict.

Currently, a Conflict is thrown for tests like
test_create_router_external_fixed_ips because an IP address will
already be in use, due to improper clean up in other tests,
causing this test to throw a Conflict exception.

Change-Id: Iec090d4740c2fd7e230086e3e35e25ef8812ba71
Closes-Bug: #1673290
Partial-Bug: #1670553

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 7923, 'name': 'Gauvain Pocentek', 'email': 'gauvainpocentek@gmail.com', 'username': 'gpocentek'}, {'_account_id': 9162, 'name': 'Lana Brindley', 'email': 'openstack@lanabrindley.com', 'username': 'loquacity'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}, {'_account_id': 12686, 'name': 'Brian Moss', 'email': 'kallimachos@gmail.com', 'username': 'bmoss'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-03-09 16:30:18.000000000', 'files': ['autogenerate_config_docs/autohelp.py', 'autogenerate_config_docs/templates/autohelp.rst.j2'], 'message': "Include 'deprecation' as a flag

There is support for displaying deprecation information in a somewhat
structured manner (proper lists, emphasis on titles, etc.). However, the
deprecation information is still included in the help text rather than
in this flags section. This makes things more difficult than they need
to be.

Resolve this by instead including any deprecation information in the
flags section. This will transform output from something like this:

  (String) DEPRECATED: Host to locate redis. Replaced by
  [DEFAULT]/transport_url

to this:

  (String) Host to locate redis.

  Deprecated
    Replaced by [DEFAULT]/transport_url

Which should be a little more obvious.

It's necessary to fix the template, which added the flags at the same
level as the title and description, resulting in varying numbers of
bullet points for the list.

Change-Id: Ifaee90a814fa3efee8b41eb0411535cff70e7309
"}]
commit_message:
Include 'deprecation' as a flag

There is support for displaying deprecation information in a somewhat
structured manner (proper lists, emphasis on titles, etc.). However, the
deprecation information is still included in the help text rather than
in this flags section. This makes things more difficult than they need
to be.

Resolve this by instead including any deprecation information in the
flags section. This will transform output from something like this:

  (String) DEPRECATED: Host to locate redis. Replaced by
  [DEFAULT]/transport_url

to this:

  (String) Host to locate redis.

  Deprecated
    Replaced by [DEFAULT]/transport_url

Which should be a little more obvious.

It's necessary to fix the template, which added the flags at the same
level as the title and description, resulting in varying numbers of
bullet points for the list.

Change-Id: Ifaee90a814fa3efee8b41eb0411535cff70e7309

subject: Avoid setuptools 34.0.0-34.3.0
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-28 01:40:51.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Avoid setuptools 34.0.0-34.3.0

Recent bugs in setuptools 34.0.0-34.3.0 caused race condition replacing
a setuptools dependency "IOError METADATA no such file", we will install
the latest version of setuptools which is 34.3.0, by specifying version
in requirements.txt, we can avoid the bug. This can be reverted once
the bug is fixed in newer setuptools version.

Change-Id: If1768a3c7c1e361f55f7349b2e960361285c1b47
Link: https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951
Related-Bug: #1667545
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid setuptools 34.0.0-34.3.0

Recent bugs in setuptools 34.0.0-34.3.0 caused race condition replacing
a setuptools dependency "IOError METADATA no such file", we will install
the latest version of setuptools which is 34.3.0, by specifying version
in requirements.txt, we can avoid the bug. This can be reverted once
the bug is fixed in newer setuptools version.

Change-Id: If1768a3c7c1e361f55f7349b2e960361285c1b47
Link: https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951
Related-Bug: #1667545

commit_message:
Correctly detect IPv6 addresses

Use the is_ip function from charmhelpers to correctly
detect and return IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

Support DNS querying for IPv6 addresses using ipv6
argument (defaults to false).

Resync tox.ini from release tools to resolve libcharmstore
compatibility issues for 1.25.x testing.

Change-Id: I719ac7db350b2b257ae057acc4299a8e97501a7b
Partial-Bug: 1622780

subject: Turn on SSH for Keystone for all distros.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-18 18:03:47.000000000', 'files': ['docker/keystone/keystone-ssh/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Turn on SSH for Keystone for all distros.

With the previous patch that was done to enable SSH access, it was
mistakingly done to be handled only in the Ubuntu case.  It should
always be done as SSH is always needed.

This is only a problem for the backport, the change introduced in
master and stable/ocata relies on the new configure_user macro
which runs regardless.

Change-Id: Ibef580748cc139f0ebf207609f934f1469222624
Closes-Bug: #1635795
'}]
commit_message:
Turn on SSH for Keystone for all distros.

With the previous patch that was done to enable SSH access, it was
mistakingly done to be handled only in the Ubuntu case.  It should
always be done as SSH is always needed.

This is only a problem for the backport, the change introduced in
master and stable/ocata relies on the new configure_user macro
which runs regardless.

Change-Id: Ibef580748cc139f0ebf207609f934f1469222624
Closes-Bug: #1635795

subject: Retrieve storage_protocol from storage backend capabilities
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 22:49:43.000000000', 'files': ['brick_cinderclient_ext/client.py', 'brick_cinderclient_ext/tests/unit/test_brick_client.py'], 'message': 'Retrieve storage_protocol from storage backend capabilities

Currently, local_attach() verifies storage_protocol from
connection_info using initialize_connection(), but this
operation is high cost because this operates storage backend
directly.

We can check storage_protocol from storage backend
capabilities using capabilities.get(host), therefore
we should change the way to retrieve storage_protocol.

Change-Id: I5aed2ba7ee086260de9a11b01116a330e239174c
Closes-Bug: #1648900
'}]
commit_message:
Retrieve storage_protocol from storage backend capabilities

Currently, local_attach() verifies storage_protocol from
connection_info using initialize_connection(), but this
operation is high cost because this operates storage backend
directly.

We can check storage_protocol from storage backend
capabilities using capabilities.get(host), therefore
we should change the way to retrieve storage_protocol.

Change-Id: I5aed2ba7ee086260de9a11b01116a330e239174c
Closes-Bug: #1648900

subject: Remove bandit.yaml in favor of default config
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-10 23:35:57.000000000', 'files': ['bandit.yaml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove bandit.yaml in favor of default config

Latest g-r version of bandit does not require a bandit.yaml. This
removes the bandit.yaml and skips the same tests that were not
run as defined by the profile before. This patch also puts running
of bandit within the pep8 testenv, consistent with other projects.

Change-Id: I7db8bc460e2051c635dc7b3fd4b152ece80c7a0c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove bandit.yaml in favor of default config

Latest g-r version of bandit does not require a bandit.yaml. This
removes the bandit.yaml and skips the same tests that were not
run as defined by the profile before. This patch also puts running
of bandit within the pep8 testenv, consistent with other projects.

Change-Id: I7db8bc460e2051c635dc7b3fd4b152ece80c7a0c

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2017-03-16 07:55:40.000000000', 'files': ['specs/pike/approved/live-migrate-rescued-instances.rst'], 'message': 'Live Migration of Rescued Instances

Add support to live migrate rescued instances. Currently instances
in rescued state cannot be live migrated. This might be an issue
during upgrades as all the active instances in the host needs
to be migrated using live-migrate.

The spec proposes a way to add support for live-migrating
rescued instances for libvirt driver.

NOTE: This spec is based on originally approved spec
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/
newton/approved/live-migrate-rescued-instances.html

APIImpact

Change-Id: Ib0b35b9a99a689b27ce1a87a8bec4d0186fc4543
'}]
commit_message:
Live Migration of Rescued Instances

Add support to live migrate rescued instances. Currently instances
in rescued state cannot be live migrated. This might be an issue
during upgrades as all the active instances in the host needs
to be migrated using live-migrate.

The spec proposes a way to add support for live-migrating
rescued instances for libvirt driver.

NOTE: This spec is based on originally approved spec
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/
newton/approved/live-migrate-rescued-instances.html

APIImpact

blueprint live-migrate-rescued-instances

Change-Id: Ib0b35b9a99a689b27ce1a87a8bec4d0186fc4543

commit_message:
conf: fix default values reporting infra worker

Default values set for console_host and
xenserver.console_public_hostname are reporting the details of the
infra worker or some python code,, thus making it unclear what the
real default value should be.

Change-Id: Iba7bf16ba30958d9c4008cc2fbf77cd9f64cf5a3
Closes-Bug: 1669847
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-pike

subject: tox: Build docs with Python 2.7
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-03-20 10:05:57.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "tox: Build docs with Python 2.7

On systems that use Python 3 as default, the 'docs' target fails due to
a non-Python 3 dependency (feedformatter, required by yasfb). It's not
even clear if yasbf is still relevant, given the uselessness of the
content published online [1]. However, it's easier to just build the
docs with Python 2 than go on a wild goose chase looking for more info.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/rss.xml

Change-Id: I129f635bc2d060f9da9bfc8b43652be7c10e9200
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Build docs with Python 2.7

On systems that use Python 3 as default, the 'docs' target fails due to
a non-Python 3 dependency (feedformatter, required by yasfb). It's not
even clear if yasbf is still relevant, given the uselessness of the
content published online [1]. However, it's easier to just build the
docs with Python 2 than go on a wild goose chase looking for more info.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/rss.xml

Change-Id: I129f635bc2d060f9da9bfc8b43652be7c10e9200

subject: Treat doc build warnings as errors
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-03-20 10:05:57.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': "Treat doc build warnings as errors

[pbr]warnerrors doesn't actually make the sphinx
docs build fail on warnings, and we have a ton of
garbage in the specs. pbr 2.0.0 removes warnerrors
so we should be using warning-is-error with sphinx
instead, which was introduced in sphinx 1.5 (we use 1.5.1).

Change-Id: Ibd087afd7a11f835d3bc74b7be1e9ccfbdcb1224
"}]
commit_message:
Treat doc build warnings as errors

[pbr]warnerrors doesn't actually make the sphinx
docs build fail on warnings, and we have a ton of
garbage in the specs. pbr 2.0.0 removes warnerrors
so we should be using warning-is-error with sphinx
instead, which was introduced in sphinx 1.5 (we use 1.5.1).

Change-Id: Ibd087afd7a11f835d3bc74b7be1e9ccfbdcb1224

subject: Re-add templates
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-20 10:05:57.000000000', 'files': ['specs/pike/implemented/pike-template.rst', 'specs/ocata/implemented/ocata-template.rst', 'tools/move_implemented_specs.py'], 'message': "Re-add templates

In commit a67d39ba, we removed templates from both the approved and
implemented folders of 'specs/{release}'. However, git tracks files, not
folders, meaning the 'implemented' folders for both Ocata and Pike,
which are currently empty, are no longer tracked and the glob patterns
used in 'doc/source/specs/{release}/index.rst cause warnings.

These templates are re-added to fix the immediate issue. However, we
still don't want to keep these around once the release has been made. As
such, we add an addition step to the tool for migrating implemented
specs to remove these templates. This should automate the process in the
future.

Change-Id: Iaae10e180845b5073e1e13a4df1050b8b98d03d7
"}]
commit_message:
Re-add templates

In commit a67d39ba, we removed templates from both the approved and
implemented folders of 'specs/{release}'. However, git tracks files, not
folders, meaning the 'implemented' folders for both Ocata and Pike,
which are currently empty, are no longer tracked and the glob patterns
used in 'doc/source/specs/{release}/index.rst cause warnings.

These templates are re-added to fix the immediate issue. However, we
still don't want to keep these around once the release has been made. As
such, we add an addition step to the tool for migrating implemented
specs to remove these templates. This should automate the process in the
future.

Change-Id: Iaae10e180845b5073e1e13a4df1050b8b98d03d7

commit_message:
More usage of ostestr and cleanup an unused dependency

Use ostestr as runner instead of the custome pretty_tox.sh script
(pretty much removed everywhere). pretty_tox3.sh is just a wrapper
for ostestr but it could be probably removed as well going forward.
Also remove the tempest-lib dependency, which originally provided
subunit-trace (now from os-testr).

Change-Id: I4390964ce83167d634b80f696e82a0e199582ce6

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21013, 'name': 'Georgy Kibardin', 'email': 'gkibardin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'gkibardin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-20 13:04:40.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/task_node.rb', 'spec/unit/task_node_spec.rb'], 'message': "Fix wrong ready status instead of stopped for stop deployment

Report ready status for node means successful node status
which can be get if all tasks was passed with ready and skipped
statuses.

Same effect can be get if Astute mark node as skipped. In this
case we also get equal status 'successful'.

So we need ask node about skipped statuses before ask it about
successful status to prevent losing context about stop
deployment operation.

Change-Id: I3c042425cab800de0bfc4e03f29414b145f44983
Closes-Bug: #1672964
(cherry picked from commit 496212798efa9f167de20a3ea0c2146658b2b466)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong ready status instead of stopped for stop deployment

Report ready status for node means successful node status
which can be get if all tasks was passed with ready and skipped
statuses.

Same effect can be get if Astute mark node as skipped. In this
case we also get equal status 'successful'.

So we need ask node about skipped statuses before ask it about
successful status to prevent losing context about stop
deployment operation.

Change-Id: I3c042425cab800de0bfc4e03f29414b145f44983
Closes-Bug: #1672964
(cherry picked from commit 496212798efa9f167de20a3ea0c2146658b2b466)

subject: roles: bifrost-create-vm-nodes: Improve host matching when deleting from vbmc
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-20 10:12:37.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/tasks/create_vm.yml'], 'message': 'roles: bifrost-create-vm-nodes: Improve host matching when deleting from vbmc

Assuming that 'vm_name' is 'foobar' then 'vm_name in vbmc_list.stdout'
will also match when there is a foobar[a-zA-Z0-9]* host registered so
there is a chance for the task to try and delete non-existing hosts
as obsereved below:

fatal: [127.0.0.1]: FAILED! => {"changed": true, "cmd": ["vbmc",
"delete", "jumphost"], "delta": "0:00:00.343033", "end": "2017-03-20
02:10:19.759738", "failed": true, "invocation": {"module_args":
{"_raw_params": "vbmc delete jumphost", "_uses_shell": false, "chdir":
null, "creates": null, "executable": null, "removes": null, "warn":
true}, "module_name": "command"}, "rc": 1, "start": "2017-03-20
02:10:19.416705", "stderr": "No domain with matching name jumphost was
found", "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": [], "warnings": []}

That happens because a 'jumphost.opnfvlocal' is registered in vbmc
but the 'vm_name' for this run is just 'jumphost'.

We fix this by using the 'find' method and looking for '{{vm_name}} '
instead.

Change-Id: I1675a978489bfd0633eabb30e2227ed7cb70c7ef
'}]
commit_message:
roles: bifrost-create-vm-nodes: Improve host matching when deleting from vbmc

Assuming that 'vm_name' is 'foobar' then 'vm_name in vbmc_list.stdout'
will also match when there is a foobar[a-zA-Z0-9]* host registered so
there is a chance for the task to try and delete non-existing hosts
as obsereved below:

fatal: [127.0.0.1]: FAILED! => {"changed": true, "cmd": ["vbmc",
"delete", "jumphost"], "delta": "0:00:00.343033", "end": "2017-03-20
02:10:19.759738", "failed": true, "invocation": {"module_args":
{"_raw_params": "vbmc delete jumphost", "_uses_shell": false, "chdir":
null, "creates": null, "executable": null, "removes": null, "warn":
true}, "module_name": "command"}, "rc": 1, "start": "2017-03-20
02:10:19.416705", "stderr": "No domain with matching name jumphost was
found", "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": [], "warnings": []}

That happens because a 'jumphost.opnfvlocal' is registered in vbmc
but the 'vm_name' for this run is just 'jumphost'.

We fix this by using the 'find' method and looking for '{{vm_name}} '
instead.

Change-Id: I1675a978489bfd0633eabb30e2227ed7cb70c7ef

case we also get equal status 'successful'.

So we need ask node about skipped statuses before ask it about
successful status to prevent losing context about stop
deployment operation.

Change-Id: I3c042425cab800de0bfc4e03f29414b145f44983
Closes-Bug: #1672964
(cherry picked from commit 496212798efa9f167de20a3ea0c2146658b2b466)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong ready status instead of stopped for stop deployment

Report ready status for node means successful node status
which can be get if all tasks was passed with ready and skipped
statuses.

Same effect can be get if Astute mark node as skipped. In this
case we also get equal status 'successful'.

So we need ask node about skipped statuses before ask it about
successful status to prevent losing context about stop
deployment operation.

Change-Id: I3c042425cab800de0bfc4e03f29414b145f44983
Closes-Bug: #1672964
(cherry picked from commit 496212798efa9f167de20a3ea0c2146658b2b466)

commit_message:
Remove tenant_id from compute endpoint

Since Nova API version 2.17, the tenant_id in the service catalog has
been optional (and recommended to not be used). This changes the
default installation instructions to not use it.

Change-Id: Id67ca1e31ea1e5ae0554bdada2a4cd62c5406b9c
See: Id92251243d9e92f30e466419110fce5781304823 for original change

commit_message:
fix update-cinder-doc release note

reno was ignoring the note because it was not in a known section, so
move it to the "config" section to reflect the fact that the changes
were in the configuration guide.

The structure of the note file was also incorrect, so that is fixed at
the same time to ensure that the YAML parser sees a list item with a
literal text block containing restructuredtext.

Change-Id: Id8977cb57adc6813140707da8ac501c544959d54
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: add a test page to the build structure for release notes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-16 20:51:46.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/config.yaml', 'releasenotes/source/unreleased.rst', 'releasenotes/source/index.rst'], 'message': 'add a test page to the build structure for release notes

The release notes build needs a page that uses an unconstrained
"release-notes" directive so that the build in the CI system includes
the patch being proposed. In cases where a branch name is specified,
only changes already merged into that branch (not submitted to it) are
included.

This patch adds the missing file using the convention used
elsewhere (calling it unreleased.rst). It leaves the release-notes
directive in index.rst because I'm not sure whether that's where you
want "published" notes to appear.

It removes the branch setting in config.yaml so that when reno is not
given a branch it uses the current branch by default. This allows
patches under test to be included in the build, so that formatting
errors in the notes will cause the build to break before the patches are
merged.

It also reorganizes the order of the release notes pages to match the
order used by convention and expected by the repository branching script
so that when this repo is branched the new release note page for the
series can be added automatically by the branch script.

Change-Id: Ibccdac675915ab3535f2b2fbc1f4daee6990048b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

squash

Change-Id: Ie795176a7e860e10acb2cfa2e9d21c1d08ba8a48
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add a test page to the build structure for release notes

The release notes build needs a page that uses an unconstrained
"release-notes" directive so that the build in the CI system includes
the patch being proposed. In cases where a branch name is specified,
only changes already merged into that branch (not submitted to it) are
included.

This patch adds the missing file using the convention used
elsewhere (calling it unreleased.rst). It leaves the release-notes
directive in index.rst because I'm not sure whether that's where you
want "published" notes to appear.

It removes the branch setting in config.yaml so that when reno is not
given a branch it uses the current branch by default. This allows
patches under test to be included in the build, so that formatting
errors in the notes will cause the build to break before the patches are
merged.

It also reorganizes the order of the release notes pages to match the
order used by convention and expected by the repository branching script
so that when this repo is branched the new release note page for the
series can be added automatically by the branch script.

Change-Id: Ibccdac675915ab3535f2b2fbc1f4daee6990048b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

squash

Change-Id: Ie795176a7e860e10acb2cfa2e9d21c1d08ba8a48
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Make skip gnocchi option overridable

Since gnocchi is the default backend, We might want to be able to
override this option and let it skip by default for compatibility.
let user set it via extra_params.

Change-Id: I23e43552e14ced5a7da5e16ef323df3b1ec6722d

commit_message:

version number is still detected with the grep.

The version I'm using is 2.5.0

Also changed the reference in the docs.

subject: Don't use --force-yes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-09 19:07:57.000000000', 'files': ['integration/scripts/trovestack', 'trove/guestagent/pkg.py'], 'message': "Don't use --force-yes

From the apt-get man page...

--force-yes
    Force yes; this is a dangerous option that will cause apt to
    continue without prompting if it is doing something potentially
    harmful. It should not be used except in very special situations.
    Using force-yes can potentially destroy your system! Configuration
    Item: APT::Get::force-yes. This is deprecated and replaced by
    --allow-downgrades, --allow-remove-essential, --allow-change-held-packages
    in 1.1.

I replaced the two occurences in the trove project.

Change-Id: I7fd70cee456a890f15288425c91ba053efe4f7e9
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use --force-yes

From the apt-get man page...

--force-yes
    Force yes; this is a dangerous option that will cause apt to
    continue without prompting if it is doing something potentially
    harmful. It should not be used except in very special situations.
    Using force-yes can potentially destroy your system! Configuration
    Item: APT::Get::force-yes. This is deprecated and replaced by
    --allow-downgrades, --allow-remove-essential, --allow-change-held-packages
    in 1.1.

I replaced the two occurences in the trove project.

Change-Id: I7fd70cee456a890f15288425c91ba053efe4f7e9

This is common in most openstack projects.

If you try running "python setup.py build_sphinx" it will return:
"error: error in setup.cfg: command 'build_sphinx' has no such option
 'warning_is_error'"

Change-Id: Ie04e97a9c4a148d1197a99a816f333cd31325504
'}]
commit_message:
Add docs to tox.ini

This would make it easier to build and test docs locally.

To run the command you can type:
tox -e docs

This is common in most openstack projects.

If you try running "python setup.py build_sphinx" it will return:
"error: error in setup.cfg: command 'build_sphinx' has no such option
 'warning_is_error'"

Change-Id: Ie04e97a9c4a148d1197a99a816f333cd31325504

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11816, 'name': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'display_name': 'Mike Bayer', 'email': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'username': 'zzzeek', 'status': 'Red Hat'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-17 16:22:04.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/database/mysql/client.pp'], 'message': "Create /etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf with proper bind-address

When fixing LP#1643487 we added ?bind_address to all DB URIs.
Since this clashes with Cellsv2 due to the URIs becoming host
dependent, we need a new approach to pass bind_address to pymysql
that leaves the DB URIs host-independent.

We first create a /etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf file with a [tripleo]
section and in this section we add the correct bind-address option.
Note that we use the puppet augeas lens and not the mysql one
because the mysql one does not support custom sections *and* there
are older versions around which do not like the /etc/my.cnf.d/* path.

The reason for not reusing an existing mariadb file (my.cnf or
galera.cnf) is that pymysql's ini file support is not robust
enough at the moment: https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/issues/548

The reason for putting this file creation code only on the controller
nodes the following: The slow VIP failover only happens if a
service runs where the VIPs exist. The VIPs get created in the
haproxy profile and that is why in order to have fast VIP failovers
the MySQLClient profile must live where the Haproxy service is running.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Partial-Bug: #1663181
Change-Id: Iff8bd2d9ee85f7bb1445aa2e1b3cfbff1f397b18
"}]
commit_message:
Create /etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf with proper bind-address

When fixing LP#1643487 we added ?bind_address to all DB URIs.
Since this clashes with Cellsv2 due to the URIs becoming host
dependent, we need a new approach to pass bind_address to pymysql
that leaves the DB URIs host-independent.

We first create a /etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf file with a [tripleo]
section and in this section we add the correct bind-address option.
Note that we use the puppet augeas lens and not the mysql one
because the mysql one does not support custom sections *and* there
are older versions around which do not like the /etc/my.cnf.d/* path.

The reason for not reusing an existing mariadb file (my.cnf or
galera.cnf) is that pymysql's ini file support is not robust
enough at the moment: https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/issues/548

The reason for putting this file creation code only on the controller
nodes the following: The slow VIP failover only happens if a
service runs where the VIPs exist. The VIPs get created in the
haproxy profile and that is why in order to have fast VIP failovers
the MySQLClient profile must live where the Haproxy service is running.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Partial-Bug: #1663181
Change-Id: Iff8bd2d9ee85f7bb1445aa2e1b3cfbff1f397b18

commit_message:
Update ci-script to enable TripleO gate dependencies

Gating tripleo-quickstart-extras changes with dependencies
on tripleo-quickstart changes is broken.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/431760/ fixes the extras
gating role. This review updates the related ci-scripts
to utilize the role changes to gate dependencies.

Depends-On: Ieaaf230155dcc2cdaafede63be193306eeb40499
Change-Id: I952a05776f2abe56522931c29594a7c60c769bc0

commit_message:
Fixes issues with raising mysql file limit

Changes Include:
 - Adds spec testing
 - Only raise limits if nonha.  puppet-systemd will restart the mariadb
   service which breaks ha deployments.  Hence we only want to do this
   in noha.
 - Minor fix to hiera value refrenced not as parameter to mysql.pp

Partial-Bug: #1648181
Related-Bug: #1524809

Co-Authored By: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id063bf4b4ac229181b01f40965811cb8ac4230d5
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
virt: implement get_inventory() for Ironic

This patch implements the new get_inventory() virt driver API method for
the Ironic driver. Included is a new functional test of the interaction
between the placement API, the resource tracker, and the scheduler
reporting client with respect to the change in the Ironic resource
reporting behaviour that corresponds to this change.

Change-Id: I59be1cbedc99dcbb0ccde089a9f4737305176324
blueprint: custom-resource-classes-pike

subject: Add better support for multi-OS deployments
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-20 11:15:18.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/repo-build.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/multi-os-wheel-repos-7910b13547ea59ad.yaml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/repo_all.yml', 'playbooks/utility-install.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': "Add better support for multi-OS deployments

This change adds a few variables which allow it to consume a repo-server
setup which has releases based on OS and ARCH. The changes require a
deployer to have at least one repo-server per-OS type being deployed.
This means that if a deployer wanted to do a mixed CentOS 7 and Ubuntu
16.04 deployment they'd need at least one repo server in each of OS type
which facilitates the building of wheels for each OS.

Change-Id: Ifd5ff22ae47bc9a2a88c1bbb2632ce48ba5accbf
Closes-Bug: 1641131
Depends-On: I3f36afa307e02a38d73b860fc23ed94a09882c34
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cacf41028b1fe398175d34cc298ce39042edf09e)
"}]
commit_message:
Add better support for multi-OS deployments

This change adds a few variables which allow it to consume a repo-server
setup which has releases based on OS and ARCH. The changes require a
deployer to have at least one repo-server per-OS type being deployed.
This means that if a deployer wanted to do a mixed CentOS 7 and Ubuntu
16.04 deployment they'd need at least one repo server in each of OS type
which facilitates the building of wheels for each OS.

Change-Id: Ifd5ff22ae47bc9a2a88c1bbb2632ce48ba5accbf
Closes-Bug: 1641131
Depends-On: I3f36afa307e02a38d73b860fc23ed94a09882c34
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cacf41028b1fe398175d34cc298ce39042edf09e)

commit_message:
Install psutil before starting memory_tracker

Part of the service is calling tools/mlock_report.py that imports the
library, and sometimes no other services pull in the dependency for us.
We should pull it ourselves.

Change-Id: I1830e396830134f8e3183d7bbbeacde305d3afe9

commit_message:
Add missing 'autospec' argument to mock.patch

Add missing 'autospec' keyword argument to mock.patch and
mock.patch.object calls. Use 'autospec=True' except for a few cases
where it fails because the mocked function is a @classmethod and it
doesn't work. In that case explicity set it to 'autospec=False'

Change-Id: I620dce91abaa4440e1803aeefb3e93c0b65d1419

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: make BGP port configurable

This allows the use of a non priviledged port on the BGP RR, and
also simplifies the deployment of multiple such RR with gobgp in the
fullstack setup (see I967ba442ef433b7ada5a1a381f1571ec3cf23517).

Change-Id: I8677ff933f94bde9a5841f8e60226904ff2517bd

subject: POC: tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-20 13:38:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/test.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_mock_sanity.py'], 'message': "POC: tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and funtions.

Wraps mock.patch methods to pass in a default autospec=True argument,
if not already given.
Adds unit test to verify that the newly wrapped mock.patch methods work
as intended.

Change-Id: I3636833962c905faa0f144c7fdc4833037324d31
"}]
commit_message:
POC: tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and funtions.

Wraps mock.patch methods to pass in a default autospec=True argument,
if not already given.
Adds unit test to verify that the newly wrapped mock.patch methods work
as intended.

Change-Id: I3636833962c905faa0f144c7fdc4833037324d31

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-03-14 13:24:58.000000000', 'files': ['resolutions/20170307-vb-platform.rst'], 'message': 'Propose VM and Bare-metal Platform Working Group

It is important we as a community make progress on problems that our
users (both people and machines) face while trying to access infrastructure
resources from the group of projects named here as the:
"VM and Bare-metal Platform"

This proposes forming a group of developers focused on ensuring progress is
made improving the user experience of this group of projects.

Not all working groups need a resolution, but this is more about putting
into writing that:

* these problems matter and need fixing
* it is OK for form a working group that has a scope that doesn't
  include all OpenStack projects.
* its the joint responsibility of a sub-set of OpenStack projects to
  work better together to make progress on these problems, including
  better understanding and documenting these problems.

Change-Id: If41b44188ae50adf38735d7dbfbdb068efbff6b4
'}]
commit_message:
Propose VM and Bare-metal Platform Working Group

It is important we as a community make progress on problems that our
users (both people and machines) face while trying to access infrastructure
resources from the group of projects named here as the:
"VM and Bare-metal Platform"

This proposes forming a group of developers focused on ensuring progress is
made improving the user experience of this group of projects.

Not all working groups need a resolution, but this is more about putting
into writing that:

* these problems matter and need fixing
* it is OK for form a working group that has a scope that doesn't
  include all OpenStack projects.
* its the joint responsibility of a sub-set of OpenStack projects to
  work better together to make progress on these problems, including
  better understanding and documenting these problems.

Change-Id: If41b44188ae50adf38735d7dbfbdb068efbff6b4

commit_message:
Use Sphinx 1.5 warning-is-error

With pbr 2.0 and Sphinx 1.5, the setting for treat sphinx warnings as
errors is setting warning-is-error in build_sphinx section. Migrate the
setting from the old warnerrors one.

There are only three related fixes required.

Change-Id: I84b020c18a8a1c7c11a35bacd61523bbb094abe4

Commit afa9951dd92e2 ("Move database setup to bifrost") moved the

commit_message:
scripts: test-bifrost.sh: Initialize the ZUUL_BRANCH variable

Commit afa9951dd92e2 ("Move database setup to bifrost") moved the
openstack_citest database setup from project-config to bifrost.
However, we need to provide a default (even if it's an empty one)
value for ZUUL_BRANCH (eg when running outside of zuul) in order
to not fail due to using 'set -u'. Fixes the following error:

./scripts/test-bifrost.sh: line 76: ZUUL_BRANCH: unbound variable

Change-Id: Iea1193ce0ac83013f4e41398b4e7ad9527d427ac
Fixes: afa9951dd92e2 ("Move database setup to bifrost")
(cherry picked from commit 1c1277bf760158dfd4127f239373ac4706a840f9)

commit_message:
Remove old oslo.messaging transport aliases

Those are remnants from the oslo-incubator times. Also, oslo.messaging
deprecated [1] transport aliases since 5.2.0+ that is the minimal
version supported for stable/newton. The patch that bumped the minimal
version for Sahara landed 3 months+ ago, so we can proceed ripping
those aliases from the code base.

[1] I314cefa5fb1803fa7e21e3e34300e5ced31bba89

Closes-Bug: #1424728

Change-Id: I02fbe5f4f9f3bda80f4fc1ea94f852e1969ce1aa

commit_message:
roles: bifrost-ironic-install: Add PyMySQL dependency for ironic-dbsync

We are using MariaDB database for ironic so we need to install
the optional PyMySQL dependency for sqlalchemy on all distributions
otherwise ironic-dbsync fails with the following error:

CRITI [ironic] ImportError: No module named pymysql
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/ironic-dbsync", line 10, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ironic/cmd/dbsync.py", line 103, in main
    CONF.command.func()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ironic/cmd/dbsync.py", line 35, in upgrade
     migration.upgrade(CONF.command.revision)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ironic/db/migration.py", line 36, in upgrade
     return get_backend().upgrade(version)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ironic/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py", line 56, in upgrade
     alembic.command.upgrade(config, revision or 'head')
  [...]
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/dialects/mysql/pymysql.py", line 49, in dbapi
     return __import__('pymysql')
ImportError: No module named pymysql

Change-Id: Ib44779de06a7bad91a08e148e1c0e1eb9815afe8

subject: Workaround for network start race condition
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'markgoddard86@gmail.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 23163, 'name': 'Markos Chandras (hwoarang)', 'email': 'markos@chandras.me', 'username': 'mchandras'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-16 08:36:15.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/ironic_config.yml'], 'message': 'Workaround for network start race condition

Add a workaround for the libvirt network start race condition bug. In
some cases the libvirt default network starts in an inactive state
with the bridge interface down. Trying to start the network via libvirt
fails because the network interface already exists. This condition is
checked for and ignored but causes the Bifrost deployment test to fail
later when templating ironic.conf as the configured network interface
has no IP address.

This change checks for the condition where the libvirt default network
is inactive and attempts to delete the associated bridge interface
before starting the libvirt network. This has been run through the CI
job and appears to resolve the issue.

Cherry-picking that because it will solve the continuous network
failures on ocata jobs.

Change-Id: Icb2baf0975ca3feb6041b2f2da9702ad6cc9fa06
Closes-Bug: #1660953
Related-Bug: #1650025
(cherry picked from commit 9c18eeac6d0072522e2537f3848b577ddb3a690d)
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround for network start race condition

Add a workaround for the libvirt network start race condition bug. In
some cases the libvirt default network starts in an inactive state
with the bridge interface down. Trying to start the network via libvirt
fails because the network interface already exists. This condition is
checked for and ignored but causes the Bifrost deployment test to fail
later when templating ironic.conf as the configured network interface
has no IP address.

This change checks for the condition where the libvirt default network
is inactive and attempts to delete the associated bridge interface
before starting the libvirt network. This has been run through the CI
job and appears to resolve the issue.

Cherry-picking that because it will solve the continuous network
failures on ocata jobs.

Change-Id: Icb2baf0975ca3feb6041b2f2da9702ad6cc9fa06
Closes-Bug: #1660953
Related-Bug: #1650025
(cherry picked from commit 9c18eeac6d0072522e2537f3848b577ddb3a690d)

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: I153c8c7ce89c7f8ed498d22cf24459054ac9b8d4
Closes-Bug: #1552251

subject: Use kolla_internal_vip_address for glance_api servers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 10:58:54.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/nova/templates/nova.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/cinder/templates/cinder.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Use kolla_internal_vip_address for glance_api servers

Nova and Cinder used a list of glance api servers - this list
does not provide a proper high availability because the servers
are connected at random without recalling who is failed last
time. E.g. out of three controllers with a failed first one nova
and cinder can try connection to the first controller because of
random / shuffled choice of the glance server. A proper solution
is to use VIP that connects to alive server from the beginning.
Also as workaround one could significantly increase max number
of retries in configuration files in hope that a random function
will choose a healthy glance server sometime - not a good choice.

Change-Id: Ifaf8ffe3697ec88a6da4c2b43c83975b63dc2e8c
Closes-Bug: #1643509
'}]
commit_message:
Use kolla_internal_vip_address for glance_api servers

Nova and Cinder used a list of glance api servers - this list
does not provide a proper high availability because the servers
are connected at random without recalling who is failed last
time. E.g. out of three controllers with a failed first one nova
and cinder can try connection to the first controller because of
random / shuffled choice of the glance server. A proper solution
is to use VIP that connects to alive server from the beginning.
Also as workaround one could significantly increase max number
of retries in configuration files in hope that a random function
will choose a healthy glance server sometime - not a good choice.

Change-Id: Ifaf8ffe3697ec88a6da4c2b43c83975b63dc2e8c
Closes-Bug: #1643509

commit_message:
Error message should not include SQL command

There is SQL command included in the http response for conflicting
resource provider. We should remove SQL related errors from the
error message.

Change-Id: I47726919f9a2d2a767564909f454c334e42ffbe0
Closes-bug: 1664117

commit_message:
nova-status: require placement >= 1.4

Since Ia1a0066dc30025c02553584a077365b28d8ff80e FilterScheduler will
no longer fall back to not using placement API. We need to require
version 1.4 to prevent NoValidHost errors.

Closes-Bug: #1669433

Change-Id: I6666cb2f558ed1f4e83f21e0317a206b07c25134

commit_message:
Add quota limit check and enhance roll back for cg create

when a consistency group is created from a source consistency group
and the number of volumes associated with the source CG exceeds
the volumes quota, the creation of the CG will fail and will leave
volumes in "creating".

This patch add the quota limit check and also let the new created
volumes can be deleted if error occured.

Change-Id: I4f2ce1999c0eee798e2f4650a940d7335c548d40
Closes-bug: #1609889

commit_message:
[ha-guide-draft] Create ha-guide draft directory

This creates a new ha-guide-draft directory to allow developing the
guide. Add infrastructure for:
* The draft guide is not translated currently.
* Build RST version (but not PDF yet) with each run.
* Publish guide as draft
* Update built index for it.

Also updates the ToC to reflect the proposed changes.

Implements: blueprint implement-ha-guide-todos

Local copy of scenario test base class

The scenario tests base class from Tempest is not a stable interface
and it's going to be refactored on Tempest side, as notified in

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112938.html

Maintain a local copy of the base class, taken from Tempest with head of
master at c5f1064759fe6c75a4bc5dc251ed1661845936cb.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21013, 'name': 'Georgy Kibardin', 'email': 'gkibardin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'gkibardin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-17 17:55:06.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/task_node.rb', 'spec/unit/task_node_spec.rb'], 'message': "Fix wrong ready status instead of stopped for stop deployment

Report ready status for node means successful node status
which can be get if all tasks was passed with ready and skipped
statuses.

Same effect can be get if Astute mark node as skipped. In this
case we also get equal status 'successful'.

So we need ask node about skipped statuses before ask it about
successful status to prevent losing context about stop
deployment operation.

Change-Id: I3c042425cab800de0bfc4e03f29414b145f44983
Closes-Bug: #1672964
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong ready status instead of stopped for stop deployment

Report ready status for node means successful node status
which can be get if all tasks was passed with ready and skipped
statuses.

Same effect can be get if Astute mark node as skipped. In this
case we also get equal status 'successful'.

So we need ask node about skipped statuses before ask it about
successful status to prevent losing context about stop
deployment operation.

Change-Id: I3c042425cab800de0bfc4e03f29414b145f44983
Closes-Bug: #1672964

commit_message:
Add handling of exit code 100 from timmy.

Diagnostic snapshot returns "Timmy: exit code 100" in the case of
insufficient disk space. In the manual docs of timmy such exit code
has more detailed description.

Change-Id: Idb2a3c31d32025e990c981ff5717309a4a536589
Closes-Bug: #1671455

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-29 22:24:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/type_vlan.py'], 'message': 'Fixes DBDeadlock race condition during driver initialization.

When multiple controllers are initially built, the ml2_vlan_allocations
will be empty and the neutron servers under different controllers will
try to populate the entry at the same time. This will cause this
DBDeadlock error as they try to access the db at the same time.

This patch set is to add db_api.retry_db_error decorator in the
_sync_vlan_allocations method to avoid this race condition.

Change-Id: I7c0e3ae515f592a5852e6decf6820b103f146761
Closes-bug: 1617499
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes DBDeadlock race condition during driver initialization.

When multiple controllers are initially built, the ml2_vlan_allocations
will be empty and the neutron servers under different controllers will
try to populate the entry at the same time. This will cause this
DBDeadlock error as they try to access the db at the same time.

This patch set is to add db_api.retry_db_error decorator in the
_sync_vlan_allocations method to avoid this race condition.

Change-Id: I7c0e3ae515f592a5852e6decf6820b103f146761
Closes-bug: 1617499

subject: Whitelist ldap group configs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-06 18:38:04.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/resource/core.py'], 'message': 'Whitelist ldap group configs

The [ldap] parameters `group_members_are_ids` and `group_ad_nesting`
were not whitelisted before, and so domain specific config files
containing those parameters could not be uploaded. These parameters are
still valid and are generally going to be specific to their respective
domains, so they should be on the whitelist.

Closes-bug: #1670382

Change-Id: I955dc00b04f0ef81573e3f10ecabd3d182e59730
'}]
commit_message:
Whitelist ldap group configs

The [ldap] parameters `group_members_are_ids` and `group_ad_nesting`
were not whitelisted before, and so domain specific config files
containing those parameters could not be uploaded. These parameters are
still valid and are generally going to be specific to their respective
domains, so they should be on the whitelist.

Closes-bug: #1670382

Change-Id: I955dc00b04f0ef81573e3f10ecabd3d182e59730

commit_message:
Add CoreOS/K8s recommended defaults to kube-proxy

The cluster-cidr fix asymetric routing in specific
use case. Adding dbus removes iptables error message for kube-proxy and
adding ${HOST_CERT_PATH} is just common practice.

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-20 11:34:14.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/repo_pre_build.yml', 'tasks/repo_venv_build.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/multi-os-wheel-repos-7910b13547ea59ad.yaml', 'tasks/repo_venv_pre_build.yml', 'tasks/repo_clone_git.yml', 'tasks/repo_build.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/repo_index.yml', 'tasks/repo_post_build.yml', 'templates/op-release-script.sh.j2', 'vars/redhat.yml', 'templates/manifest.in.j2', 'templates/op-venv-script.sh.j2', 'tests/test-repo-build.yml'], 'message': 'Modified repo build for better multi-OS support

The repo build role will now store all wheels and venvs in directories
containg information about the OS in which the bits were build on. The
intention here is to ensure that all installation are able to support
multi-OS without running into issues caused by system packages and
different core libs. This change builds upon the multi-archetecture
support we already have.

Closes-Bug: 1641131
Change-Id: I3f36afa307e02a38d73b860fc23ed94a09882c34
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit fe3ae20f74a912925d5c78040984957a6d55f9de)
'}]
commit_message:
Modified repo build for better multi-OS support

The repo build role will now store all wheels and venvs in directories
containg information about the OS in which the bits were build on. The
intention here is to ensure that all installation are able to support
multi-OS without running into issues caused by system packages and
different core libs. This change builds upon the multi-archetecture
support we already have.

Closes-Bug: 1641131
Change-Id: I3f36afa307e02a38d73b860fc23ed94a09882c34
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit fe3ae20f74a912925d5c78040984957a6d55f9de)

commit_message:
flake8: Specify 'ironic_lib' as name of app

Specify 'ironic_lib' as the name of the application for the flake8-import-order
plugin. That way it knows that imports of ironic_lib should come after external
libraries.

Change-Id: I6c88a6a8142634c1194832896f40f9bc9c122367

commit_message:
Detect monasca-api with WSGI as Python implementation

Since monasca-api can now be run as WSGI with apache server,
monasca_setup should detect this as a Python implementation
of monasca-api.

Change-Id: I8e42b1886de69538092d6314e39efdfe927820e3
Closes-Bug: #1673407
(cherry picked from commit 4857aac434016b100feff3b68d4e1c6f7427ff78)

subject: Bypass min_part_hours check for the AIO
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-17 10:04:34.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2'], 'message': 'Bypass min_part_hours check for the AIO

During the upgrade check for the AIO the swift rebalance
happens for the new version before an hour of time has
passed, resulting in a rebalance attempt failure.

For the AIO this bypasses that check as we have a fair
certainty in the AIO that the rings are balanced in less
time than the default minimum.

Change-Id: I1cec668460cef19d3514f92480f9a82166bf898c
'}]
commit_message:
Bypass min_part_hours check for the AIO

During the upgrade check for the AIO the swift rebalance
happens for the new version before an hour of time has
passed, resulting in a rebalance attempt failure.

For the AIO this bypasses that check as we have a fair
certainty in the AIO that the rings are balanced in less
time than the default minimum.

Change-Id: I1cec668460cef19d3514f92480f9a82166bf898c

commit_message:
devstack: Don't modprobe inside containers

When running in a container, the host must already have the modules
inserted in its kernel.

Change-Id: Ic61ad57557be5dd1319db70bfb50c23836874028

commit_message:
Remove old oslo.messaging transport aliases

Those are remnants from the oslo-incubator times. Also, oslo.messaging
deprecated [1] transport aliases since 5.2.0+ that is the minimal
version supported for stable/newton. The patch that bumped the minimal
version for Ironic landed 3 months+ ago, so we can proceed ripping
those aliases from the code base.

[1] I314cefa5fb1803fa7e21e3e34300e5ced31bba89

Change-Id: I42dcc4b64f0b8e667abad68f7a5ed1ba004ec329
Closes-Bug: #1424728

subject: Replaces string concatenation based on '+'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-12 16:12:34.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cmd/cleanup.py', 'tempest/lib/common/utils/data_utils.py', 'tempest/services/object_storage/object_client.py', 'tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/api/object_storage/test_container_acl.py', 'tempest/api/identity/admin/v3/test_default_project_id.py', 'tempest/api/object_storage/test_container_acl_negative.py', 'tempest/common/dynamic_creds.py', 'tempest/lib/common/utils/test_utils.py', 'tempest/api/object_storage/test_object_services.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_personality.py', 'tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py', 'tempest/common/preprov_creds.py', 'tempest/lib/services/network/base.py', 'tempest/stress/stressaction.py', 'tempest/tests/lib/test_auth.py'], 'message': "Replaces string concatenation based on '+'

Concatenating strings with '+' is usually considered an anti-pattern,
since strings are immutable. It generally ends up creating too many
intermediate strings which can be costly.

This patch replaces '+' string concatenation with one of the different
available options:

* .join() method on strings
* os.path.join when it's a filesystem path
* '%' syntax when needed

Change-Id: I5a071d03ac5c26e70bcb23482a5f079422577910
"}]
commit_message:
Replaces string concatenation based on '+'

Concatenating strings with '+' is usually considered an anti-pattern,
since strings are immutable. It generally ends up creating too many
intermediate strings which can be costly.

This patch replaces '+' string concatenation with one of the different
available options:

* .join() method on strings
* os.path.join when it's a filesystem path
* '%' syntax when needed

Change-Id: I5a071d03ac5c26e70bcb23482a5f079422577910

commit_message:
Drop localrc references

devstack-gate supports local.conf over localrc now:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326585/

This broke our tempest check, so dropping the only element filling
localrc file (sourcing devstackgaterc is needed all the time anyway to
get the DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX variable)

Change-Id: I9ee5e18cc5c879de500517e9c663ce99d01218d6
Closes-Bug: 1667485
(cherry picked from commit f081f642525b6027f1cad114d3d835bfd507e7dc)
